For the treatment of this condition, if there is swelling and pain with internal and external ulceration, it is best to use a decoction of peony and thistle, or a modified Si Wu Decoction with gardenia, moutan root, gentian, and schisandra. Alternatively, a modified Xiao Yao San may be used. If there is dampness and itching, a decoction of peony and thistle or Gui Pi Decoction with encouraging herbs, gardenia, and moutan root is recommended. In the case of painful urination with a thick discharge, Long Dan Decoction for clearing the liver should be taken with white atractylodes and moutan root added. If there is profuse discharge and severe pain and swelling due to excessive heat, Da Fen Qing Yin or Chou Xin Yin should be utilized. For swelling with toxic buildup, Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction should be taken with gardenia and moutan root added. For cases that can be washed, a hundred herb decoction should be used. For those that can be applied externally, Piao Xiao San or Wan Chuang San is recommended.

Lower Sores

Lower sores are essentially a condition of liver and kidney damp-heat. If there is no external cause for the illness, it suffices to clear the damp-heat or nourish the true yin. Once the damp-heat is cleared, the sores will heal on their own, and there will be no need for excessive worry. However, if one is affected by toxic forces, depending on the depth of the poison, the severity of the illness varies, and it is advisable to use a hundred herb wash treatment, applying Piao Xiao San externally; lighter cases will resolve themselves. If the damp-heat is severe and causes swelling and pain, a decoction of peony and thistle should be administered to treat both aspects. If the toxicity is intense, Bi Xie Decoction can also be used. If one is affected by evil influences and the poison penetrates directly into the essence palace, recovery is not easy; treatment should follow the aforementioned methods. However, if no visible poison shows itself and a broad sore appears, then only after the lower sores begin to heal will the treatment follow as mentioned under the respective section. Upon observation of sore and poison, treatment should be directed as noted in the relevant context.[146p]

　　　　　便毒

　　便毒论，治如薛氏之法，固已详矣。然又惟交感不洁，遭淫毒而患者，为最多。每每先起下疳，下疳未已，便毒继之，此湿热秽毒之为患也。凡初起肿痛，尚未成脓，而元气尚强者，速宜先去其毒，惟会脓散或牡蛎散为最善。若已成脓，则或针或蚀，惟速去其脓，随因证调补，使速收口为善。　　若初起一核，其痛微，其肿漫者，此有二证，一以邪轻，一以元气虚弱，毒深而然。若邪轻者，只用会通膏加麝香贴之，无有不散，或降痈散亦可。若元气虚弱而毒深者，既不肯散，又不早溃，愈久必愈甚，最为可畏。及其溃后，多不能收，轻则为瘘，重则殒命，此惟大补元气，方不致害。　　若焮肿痛甚，脓已将成，势不能消，宜用降痈散留头围之，则势可敛、痛可解、脓可速成而溃也。[147p]

Bian Du

The discussion on bian du (venereal disease) is thoroughly detailed according to the method of the Xue family. However, it is primarily those who engage in unclean interactions and encounter toxic influences that suffer the most. This often begins with a sore on the lower part of the body, and before it has healed, the bian du follows. This is the harm caused by damp heat and filthy toxins.

In the initial stage of swelling and pain, when pus has not yet formed and the vital energy remains strong, it is crucial to eliminate the poison quickly. The best remedies are either Hui Pung San or Mu Li San. If pus has already formed, it may be addressed by puncturing or cauterizing; the key is to remove the pus swiftly and adjust treatment according to the resulting symptoms for quick healing.

If a lump first appears with mild pain and swelling, there are two indications: one is a light邪 (pathogenic factor), and the other is weak vital energy with deep toxicity. For a light邪, using Hui Tong Gao with musk as a plaster will ensure dispersal; alternatively, Jiang Ying San can also be used. If the vital energy is weak and the toxicity deep, it neither disperses nor ruptures early, and the longer it persists, the worse it becomes, making it particularly feared. After it ruptures, it often cannot heal; the mild case may result in a fistula, and the severe may lead to death. Therefore, substantial replenishment of vital energy is essential to avoid harm.

If there is intense swelling and pain, and pus is about to form and cannot be resolved, it is advisable to use Jiang Ying San while leaving the head intact; this can help contain the situation, relieve pain, and promote the rapid formation and rupture of pus.[147p]

　　　　石室秘箓 【清　陈士铎】

　　　　　强阳不倒

　　强阳不倒，此虚火炎上，而肺金之气，不能下行故尔。若用黄蘗、知母二味煎汤饮之，立时消散。然而自倒之后，终岁经年，不能重振，亦自苦也。方用元参、麦冬各三两，肉桂三分，水煎服即倒。此方妙在元参以泻肾中浮游之火；尤妙肉桂三分，引其入宅，而招致其沸越之火，同气相求，火自回合。况麦冬又助肺金之气清肃下行以生肾水，水足，火自息矣。[148p]

Secret Formula of the Stone Chamber
[Qing Dynasty, Chen Shiduo]

The Strong Yang Does Not Fall

The strong yang does not fall; this is due to the excess fire rising up, preventing the lung's metal energy from descending. If one uses a decoction of huangbo (phelodendron) and zhimu (anemarrhena), it will immediately disperse. However, if it falls afterward, persisting for a whole year and beyond without recovery, it becomes a source of suffering. The formula should include three taels of yuanshen (radix polygalae) and maidong (ophiopogon), along with three fen of rougui (cinnamon), boiled in water for consumption to restore balance. This formula is effective because yuanshen helps to drain the floating fire from the kidneys; especially, the three fen of rougui draws it inward, inviting the excessive fire back into balance, as they seek each other in harmony. Moreover, maidong further assists the lung's metal energy in descending to generate kidney water; when there is sufficient water, the fire will naturally cease.[148p]

　　　　　痿阳不振

　　至于痿而不振者，乃过于琢削，日泄其肾中之水，而肾中之火，亦日消亡。盖水去而火亦去，必然之理。如一家人口，厨下无水，又何以煮爨而生烟？必汲其泉源，而后取其薪炭，可以钻燧取火，以煮饮食，否则空铛安爨也。方用熟地一两，山茱萸四钱，远志、巴戟天、杜仲、肉苁蓉各一钱，人参、枸杞子各三钱，茯神、肉桂各二钱，白朮五钱，水煎服，一剂起，二剂强，三剂妙。老人倍加。此方用热药于补水之中，则火起而不愁炎烧之祸，自然煮汤可饮，煮米可餐，断不致焦釜沸干，或虞爆碎也。　　阳倒不举，方用熟地一斤，黄芪二斤，巴戟天、当归各六两，肉桂、柏子仁去油，覆盆子、麦冬各三两，白朮八两，各为末，蜜为丸，每日白滚汤送下一两，自然阳旺不倒矣。[149p]

Weak Yang and Lack of Vitality

When there is weakness and lack of vitality, it stems from excessive refinement, which leads to the daily depletion of the water in the kidneys, while the fire in the kidneys also gradually diminishes. Indeed, when water leaves, fire must also leave; this is a necessary principle. For example, if a household has no water in the kitchen, how can they cook and create smoke? One must first draw water from the source before gathering firewood; only then can fire be ignited to cook food. Otherwise, the pot remains empty and unheated.

One should use one tael of cooked rehmannia, four qian of cornelian cherry, one qian each of polygala root, morinda root, eucommia bark, and cistanche, three qian each of ginseng and goji berries, two qian each of poria and cinnamon, and five qian of white atractylodes, boiled in water. One dose rises, two doses strengthen, and three doses are wonderful. For elderly individuals, the dosage should be increased. This method uses warm herbs to replenish water; thus, fire rises without concern for burning calamities, naturally allowing for broth to be consumed and rice to be cooked, preventing the pot from burning dry or risking explosions.

For Yang that is completely down, use one jin of cooked rehmannia, two jin of astragalus, six liang each of morinda root and Angelica, and three liang each of cinnamon and biota seed (washed of oil), as well as raspberry and ophiopogon, and eight liang of white atractylodes, all ground into powder and formed into pills with honey. Take one tael daily with boiling broth, and naturally, the Yang will thrive and not falter.[149p]

　　　　　狐疝

　　男子与女子之治，原无分别，然而亦有殊处。男子与妇人殊者，疝病，阳强不倒、痿而不举。然而疝病与妇人异者，止狐疝不同耳，余俱相同。狐疝者，日间缩在囊之上，夜间垂在囊之下也。此乃寒湿，又感阴阳不正之气，乘于交感之际，或在神道之旁，或在风湿之际，感而成之也。方用杜若五钱，捣汁，以凉水浣之，取汁一碗，加沙参一两，肉桂、桂枝、小茴香、橘核各一钱，水煎服。一服即伸出，二服即消，三服全愈。[150p]

Fox Hernia

In the treatment of men and women, there is fundamentally no difference, yet there are unique aspects. The difference in conditions between men and women lies in hernias, where men may experience strong yang but still suffer from impotence. However, concerning hernias, the only distinction for women is the fox hernia; all others are the same. The fox hernia retracts during the day above the pouch and hangs down at night below the pouch. This condition arises from cold and dampness, along with the improper influences of yin and yang, occurring at the moment of interaction, or along the pathways of spirit or during damp conditions.

For treatment, use five qian of wormwood, pound it to extract the juice, wash it with cold water, take one bowl of the juice, add one liang of sand ginseng, and one qian each of cassia, cinnamon twig, fennel, and tangerine kernel. Boil in water and consume. One dose will allow it to extend, two doses will reduce it, and three doses will achieve complete recovery.[150p]

　　　　方

　　固真汤 【《东垣十书》，下同】 　治阴汗湿痒，正月内定此方。　　升麻　柴胡　羌活各一钱　炙甘草　泽泻各一钱半　草龙胆炒　知母炒　黄蘗各二钱　　右銼如麻豆大，水三盏，煎至一盏，稍热空心服，以美膳压之。
　　升阳除湿汤　治两外肾冷，两髀枢阴汗，前阴痿弱，阴囊湿痒，臊气。　　泽泻　升麻各一钱半　红花少许　生甘草　黄蘗酒制，各二钱　草龙胆　当归梢　羌活　麻黄根　柴胡　汉防己　白茯苓各一钱　五味子二十粒　　右水三大盏，煎至一盏，稍热服，食前。忌酒、湿面、房事。
　　龙胆泻肝汤　治阴部时复湿痒及臊臭。　　柴胡梢　泽泻各一钱　车前子　木通各五分　当归梢　龙胆草　生地黄各三分　　右(口父)咀，水三大盏，煎至一盏，空心稍热服，更以美膳压之。[151p]

Fang (Formula)

Guzhen Decoction
This treats Yin-type sweating, dampness, and itching; designated in the first month.

  • Shengma (Angelicae Sinensis) - 1 qian
  • Chaihu (Bupleuri Radix) - 1 qian
  • Qianghuo (Notopterygii Rhizoma) - 1 qian
  • Zhi Gancao (Honey-fried Licorice) - 1.5 qian
  • Zexie (Alismatis Rhizoma) - 1.5 qian
  • Cao Longdan (Stir-fried Gentiana) - 2 qian
  • Zhimu (Anemarrhenae Rhizoma) - 2 qian
  • Huanglian (Coptidis Rhizoma) - 2 qian

Preparation: Grind into powder the size of a soybean, add 3 cups of water, boil down to 1 cup, take warm on an empty stomach, and follow with a nourishing meal.

Shengyang Zhushi Decoction
This treats external cold in the kidneys, dampness in the thighs, weakness in the genital area, scrotal wetness and itching, and odor.

  • Zexie (Alismatis Rhizoma) - 1.5 qian
  • Shengma (Angelicae Sinensis) - 1.5 qian
  • Honghua (Carthami Flos) - a little
  • Shenggancao (Raw Licorice) - 2 qian
  • Huanglian (Coptidis Rhizoma) - 2 qian (prepared with wine)
  • Cao Longdan (Stir-fried Gentiana) - 1 qian
  • Danggui (Angelica Sinensis) - 1 qian
  • Qianghuo (Notopterygii Rhizoma) - 1 qian
  • Mahuanggen (Ephedrae Radix) - 1 qian
  • Chaihu (Bupleuri Radix) - 1 qian

Pang Cong San: [from "He Ji"] Treats men and women with spleen and stomach deficiency and cold, attacking the heart and abdomen causing pain in the ribs, chest tightness, and back pain that extends to the neck, loss of appetite, occasional vomiting, cholera-like cramping, abdominal cold diarrhea, bladder qi stabbing the small intestine, and swelling pain in the outer kidney; also treats women's blood and qi attacks, symptoms and lumps that are hard, discharge of red and white, possible chills and fever, before and after childbirth, continuous abnormal bleeding, abdominal pain, and all signs of deficiency and cold.

  • Tao Ren
  • Honghua
  • Danggui Xu, each in equal portions
  • One piece of (Cao) Lou

Mouth-chew them, and boil in one bowl each of water and wine, reducing to two-thirds, strain, expose to night dew, then take warm on an empty stomach, inducing over ten bowel movements.

Qingxin Liuqi Decoction treats the anterior condition.

White Atractylodes, Poria, Polyporus, Alisma, Ophiopogon, Aged Tangerine Peel, Siler, Bupleurum, Notopterygium, Red Peony, Cyperus, Raw Rehmannia, Chuanxiong, Perilla, Licorice. Take these (chew), three slices of ginger, one date, and boil in water to take. For difficulty urinating, add Plantago seeds, Talcum, and Akebia.

Opopanax Powder [from "Riren Shiqin"] treats dysentery. Opopanax, Myrrh, Talcum Powder, Yellow Lead, Dragon Bone, Catfish Bone, Coptis, Scutellaria, Verdigris, all in equal parts, with a little Musk. Crush into a fine powder, wash with warm starch water, and apply to the sore.

Dysentery Powder treats the same condition.

Toad, Wood Fragrance, Sulfur, Iron Essence in equal parts. Prepare this on the fifth day of the fifth month into a powder, add a little Musk, and apply to the affected area.

Qingmuxiang Pill [from "Introduction to Medicine"] treats cold hernias and bladder hernia gas swelling. Broken paper, Pseudocinchona, Betel Nut each two liang, Qingmuxiang one liang, and three liang of Black Chou Head powder. Grind finely, make into water pills the size of wutong seeds, hollow, and take fifty pills with salt water.[160p]

Qingmu Xiang Pill: 200 pills, 7 mallow insects.

Stir-fry them together until slightly fragrant, cover with porcelain, and let cool, removing the mallow insects. Take 50 pills with fennel wine. This is because hernias pertain to the liver; hence, mallow is used to treat wind.

Danggui Sini Decoction: Treats cold hernia with cold pain below the navel. Ingredients: 1.2 qian of angelica, 1 qian each of aconite, cinnamon, and fennel, 9 fen each of white peony and bupleurum, 7 fen each of corydalis, Sichuan olive, and poria, and 5 fen of alisma. Grind into a powder, make a decoction with water, and take on an empty stomach.

Lamb Soup: Treats cold hernia with bloating and pain below the navel, where the hand dares not approach. Ingredients: 1 jin of lamb, 5 liang of fresh ginger, 3 liang of angelica. Boil with 8 sheng of water until obtaining 3 sheng, and take 7 he each time, three times a day.

Green Onion White Powder: Treats cold qi leading to pain in the bladder. Ingredients: 5 fen each of chuanxiong, angelica, bitter orange, magnolia bark, poria, sparganium, cinnamon, dried ginger, ginseng, jinjue, malt, green skin, fennel, wood fragrance, cooked rehmannia, white peony, red poria, and Sichuan prickly ash. Grind into a powder, add 2 stalks of green onion and a spoonful of salt, and decoct for consumption.[161p]

Four Divine Pills [from "Danxi Heart Method"]
Used to treat cold hernia with swelling and pain.
Use half of Wu Zhuyu soaked in wine and half soaked in vinegar, then dry it.
Add five qian each of Bichengqie and Qingmuxiang, and one liang of Dahuangfu.
Grind them into powder, form into pills the size of a walnut, and take with salty soup, about seventy to eighty pills.

Secret Dispersing Pill of Wu Zhuyu [from "Direct Point Formulas"]
Used to treat hernia and swollen areas of the genitals, or sores that leak yellow fluid.
Soak half Wu Zhuyu in wine and half in vinegar overnight, then dry it.
Add Shan Zhuyu, cinnamon, and Ma Linhua soaked in vinegar and dried.
Then add powdered Muxiang, Heichoutou, stir-fried fennel with salt, fried Yanhusuo, Chuanlian flesh, Qingpi, and Chenpi (remove the white part), and washed and dried Haizhao.
Fry Tao Ren and Bai Jizhi, each five qian.
Grind them into powder, form into pills the size of a walnut with wine paste, and take with salty soup or warm wine, about fifty to seventy pills.

Mufan Dan [from "Medical Entry", same below]
Used to treat sores on the scrotum that leak fluid, causing severe itching and pain upon scratching.
Use two liang each of oyster powder and yellow lead, and four liang of dried white alum.[162p]

　　右为末，遇夜用手捏药于痒处擦之，连擦三四次，自然平复。

The above text outlines various traditional Chinese medicinal recipes for treating ailments related to hernias, specifically indicating methods for relief from symptoms like swelling and pain due to damp heat.

  1. For itching, the advice is to pinch some medicine and rub it on the itchy area three to four times until it naturally subsides.

  2. Modified Chai Ling Decoction is prescribed for various hernias caused by damp heat leading to swelling and pain. Ingredients include herbs such as Chai Hu, Ze Xie, Ban Xia, Chi Fu Ling, Lychee Seed, Bai Zhu, Zhu Ling, Shan Zha, and Zhi Zi, mixed and brewed, with a substitution of orange seeds if lychee seeds are unavailable.

  3. Shen Sheng Dai Zhen San treats blood-stasis hernia pain and other sharp pains associated with hernias. It includes Frankincense, Myrrh (degreased), Angelica, Bai Zhi, Chuan Xiong, and Yan Qing, ground into powder. It is taken in a specific manner, where one dose is mixed into a cup of good tea and sipped delicately without stirring.

  4. Dang Shan Wan is used for treating Qi hernia. Ingredients include herbs like Feng Zhu, Mu Xiang, and special preparations of various seeds, all mixed into pills that are taken with alcohol.

  5. Qi Hernia Drink also addresses Qi hernia, using preparations like Huang Lian and Wu Zhu Yu boiled and mixed with other ingredients like Gan Cao, Ren Shen, Bai Zhu, Bai Shao, and Chen Pi, brewed with slices of ginger for consumption.[163p]

　　三茱丸 【《丹溪心法》】 　治气疝肿痛。　　山茱萸　吴茱萸　食茱萸各二两　川楝一两　破故纸炒，一两七钱　螌蝥十四个，同炒赤，去蝥　黑丑头末炒一两　青盐　青皮　茴香炒，各三钱　　右为末，酢面糊和丸梧子大，先嚼桃仁十五粒，以温酒或盐汤下三五十九。
　　聚香饮子 【《医学入门》】 　治七情所伤，遂成疝气。　　乳香另研　沉香　白檀香　木香　藿香叶　丁香各八分　延胡索　姜黄　乌药　桔梗　桂心　甘草各四分　　右銼，作一贴，姜三片，枣二枚，水煎服。
　　二香丸 【《丹溪心法》】 　治狐疝上下出入作痛，或疝痛作则腹内块痛止，疝痛止则腹内块痛复作。　　木香　香附子各三两　山楂肉二两　三棱　蓬朮并酢煮　神鞠　姜黄　南星各一两　黄连与吴茱萸同炒　萝卜子　桃仁　栀子仁　橘核炒，各五钱　　右为末，姜汁浸蒸，饼丸梧子大，白汤下五七十丸。[164p]

San Zhu Wan
Treats abdominal pain caused by qi stagnation and swelling.
Two taels each of Shan Zhu Yu, Wu Zhu Yu, and Shi Zhu Yu; one tael of Chuan Lian; one tael and seven qian of po gu zhi, fried; fourteen Gan Mao insects, fried until red, remove the insects; one tael of Hei Chou Tou powder, fried; three qian each of Qing Yan, Qing Pi, and Hui Xiang, fried.
Grind them into powder, mix with vinegar to make pills the size of a walnut. First chew fifteen peach seeds, then take with warm wine or salt soup, three to five times.

Ju Xiang Yin Zi
Treats injuries from the seven emotions that lead to hernia.
Grind separately Frankincense, Chen Xiang, Bai Dan Xiang, Mu Xiang, Huo Xiang leaves, and Ding Xiang, each eight fen; four fen each of Yan Hu Suo, Jiang Huang, Wu Yao, Jie Geng, Gui Xin, and Gan Cao.
Grind these into a mixture, add three slices of ginger and two jujubes, and decoct in water to take.

Er Xiang Wan
Treats fox hernia with pain appearing intermittently; when hernia pain stops, abdominal lumps cause pain again.
Three taels each of Mu Xiang and Xiang Fu Zi; two taels of Shan Zha meat; one tael each of San Leng and Peng Zhu, boiled with vinegar; one tael each of Shen Ju, Jiang Huang, and Nan Xing; together with Huang Lian and Wu Zhu Yu, fried; five qian each of Luo Bo Zi, Tao Ren, Zhi Zi Ren, and Ju He, fried.
Grind into powder, soak in ginger juice and steam, form into pills the size of a walnut, and take with clear soup, five to seventy pills.[164p]

　　天台乌药散 【《东垣十书》】 　治小肠气。　　川楝子十个，以巴豆十四粒，同麸炒黑色，去豆麸　乌药　木香　茴香炒　良姜　青皮各五钱　槟榔三钱　　右为细末，每一钱温酒调下；痛甚，炒姜热酒下。
　　救命通心散 【《医学纲目》】 　治小肠气痛。　　川乌一两，以青盐一钱。酒一盏，浸一宿，去皮尖焙　川楝子肉一两，以巴豆肉二十一粒，同炒黑，去豆　茴香五钱　石燕一对，火煅酢淬　土狗五枚　芥子一钱六分　　右为末，每三钱，入羊石子内，湿纸裹煨熟，夜半时，好酒半斤，入盐细嚼石子，以酒咽下，不得作声。小便大利，其病即去。[165p]

Tiantai Wuyao San: This formula treats small intestine qi issues. Take ten Chuanlianzi and fourteen pieces of Ba Dou, roast together with wheat until black, then remove the bean and wheat. Add five qian each of Wuyao, muxiang (wood fragrance), foeniculum (fennel), and liangjiang (galanga); three qian of Binglang (betel nut). Grind everything into a fine powder. For each qian, mix with warm wine and take it. If the pain is severe, take with hot wine and ginger.

Jiùmìng Tǒngxīn San: This formula treats small intestine qi pain. Use one liang of Chuanwu and a qian of Qingyan (green salt). Soak in one cup of wine overnight, then peel and roast. Use one liang of Chuanlianzi meat and twenty-one pieces of Ba Dou meat, fry until black, then remove the bean. Add five qian of foeniculum, a pair of shiyan (stone swallow) fired and vinegar-quenched, five pieces of tudu (earth dog), and one qian six fen of mustard seeds. Grind everything into a powder. For every three qian, place in sheep stones, wrap with damp paper, and steam until cooked. At midnight, take half a jin of good wine, chew the stones in salt finely, and swallow with the wine without making a sound. Urination will increase significantly, and the illness will resolve.[165p]

　　去铃丸 【《医学入门》】 　大治小肠疝气。　　茴香一斤，以生姜一斤取自然汁，浸一宿，约姜汁尽入茴香，然后入青盐二两同炒赤，取出焙燥　　右为末，酒糊丸梧子大，每三五十丸，温酒米饮任下。此药全实脾胃，且有盐能引入下部，有姜汁专一发散而无疏导之害，服之累效。
　　加味通心饮 【《得效方》】 　治小肠疝气热痛，小便不通。　　瞿麦　木通　栀子　黄芩　连翘　枳壳　川楝子　甘草各一钱　　右銼，作一贴，灯心三十茎，车前草五叶，同煎服。

Qulingwan [“Introduction to Medicine”]
For treating small intestine hernia. One pound of fennel, extract natural juice from one pound of fresh ginger, soak overnight until the ginger juice is absorbed by the fennel. Then add two taels of blue salt and stir-fry until red, remove and dry. Grind this mixture into powder, form pills the size of a walnut with wine paste, take thirty to fifty pills with warm wine or rice drink as needed. This medicine can strengthen the spleen and stomach, and the salt helps draw downwards. The ginger juice specifically disperses without harmful laxative effects, and the effects accumulate.

Jiawei Tongxin Drink [“Effective Formulas”]
For treating hot pain in small intestine hernia, with difficulty in urination. One qian each of: Cornelian cherry, Akebia, Cape jasmine, Scutellaria, Forsythia, Bitter orange, Chinaberry, and Licorice. Grind these together to make a paste, then add thirty stalks of lantern wick and five leaves of Plantago, and decoct to take.

Juan Tong Wan [“Direct Reference Formulas”]
For pain in the small intestine and bladder due to Qi. One tael of Corydalis, five qian each of: Chinaberry flesh, stir-fried fennel, and white charcoal powder. Two and a half qian each of: Angelica, Zingiber, green peel, wood fragrance, and myrrh, and seven whole scorpions roasted. Grind this mixture into powder, soak in ginger juice, steam into pills the size of a walnut, and take with wine mixed with burned cotton ash, three to fifty pills as needed.[166p]

Xia Shan Pill (from "Jilüe")
Treats small intestine hernia.
One pound of bitter orange root, soaked in urine and sliced.
Four taels of slightly roasted Sichuan pepper.
Four taels of white poria and stir-fried fennel.
One pound of white onion, chopped, stir-fried with one tael of salt until yellow, then remove the onion.
Grind all into a powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of a jujube, take five to seventy pills with warm wine.

Li Xiao Powder (from "Zisheng Fang")
Treats small intestine qi pain.
Seven whole scorpions.
Thirty-seven pieces of sand toad.
One liang of fennel.
Grind all into a powder, divide into three doses, mix with hot wine and take on an empty stomach for immediate effect.

Zhuyu Neixiao Pill (from "Yixue Rumen")
Treats bladder and kidney deficiency leading to cold hernia, uneven pull and pain, and small intestine bashful interstitial problems.
Two taels each of cornelian cherry, evodia, Chinese winged-berry, horse mint flower, fennel, green tangerine peel, dried tangerine peel, Chinese yam, and cinnamon; one tael of costus.
Grind all into a powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of a jujube, take fifty pills with wine.

Yang's Musk Pill (from "Zhizhi Fang")
Can seek out various pains. Commonly, bladder qi and pain under the ribs are the most difficult to treat; this medicine is effective for it.
One tael each of costus and pepper; four qian each of roasted scorpion and croton.
One qian of musk.
Grind all into a powder, mix with steamed cake to form pills the size of sesame seeds, coat with red lead, and take fifty pills with warm water.[167p]

　　金铃散 【《直指方》】 　治膀胱小肠气肿痛。　　大川楝肉三十枚，切片，以巴豆肉三十粒作片同炒焦，去巴豆　茴香炒，与川楝肉等分　木香一钱半　　右为末，每二钱，水酒各半，煎葱白汤调下，空心。

Jinling San (from "Zhi Zhi Fang")
Treats bladder and small intestine distension pain.
Thirty pieces of Fructus Meliae, sliced, and stir-fried until charred with thirty seeds of Croton, then remove the Croton and stir-fry with fennel. Mix equally with:

  • 1.5 qian of Mu Xiang
    Grind into a powder. For each dose of 2 qian, mix equal parts of water and wine, decoct in scallion white soup to take on an empty stomach.

Ju He San (from "Dan Xi Xin Fa")
Treats four types of (inguinal) hernia; for chronic cases, use Ju He Wan; for acute cases, use Ju He San.

  • 1.5 qian of tangerine seeds
  • 15 pieces of peach kernel
  • 1 qian of gardenia seeds
  • 0.5 qian each of fried Aconitum and Evodia
    Stir-fry each into a coarse powder, make into a paste, and decoct in water for consumption. "Ru Men" states: the tangerine seed alone alleviates pain, Aconitum disperses cold stagnation, gardenia removes damp heat, guiding Aconitum to descend quickly and preventing it from lingering in the stomach, making these remedies highly effective.

Chuan Lian San
[From "Zhi Zhi Fang"]
Treats wood kidney and external kidney, bloating, numbness, pain, rigidity, and conditions of tun (testicular) hernia that tends to sag.
Forty-nine Chuan Lianzi (Fruit of Melia Toosendan). First, cut seven, extract the flesh, and stir-fry with two and a half qian of fennel and set aside; then cut seven, stir-fry with two and a half qian of broken paper, and set aside; then cut seven, stir-fry with two and a half qian of black chuilu, and set aside; then cut seven, stir-fry with one qian of salt, and set aside; then cut seven, stir-fry with fourteen chanwa (a type of insect), and remove the insects; then cut seven, stir-fry with fourteen ba dou (purgative bean), and remove the ba dou; finally, cut seven and stir-fry with two and a half qian of radish seeds, removing the seeds.
Then add the following medicines: stir-fried fennel, five qian; wood fragrance, five qian; spicy cassia, two and a half qian.
Prepare into a powder, mix with wine to make pills the size of a walnut, and take with three to five spoonfuls of salt and wine. To treat stasis blood in the wood kidney, add five qian of yan hu suo (corydalis) slightly stir-fried and mix with myrrh powder, swallowing with warm wine.

[From "Wan Bing Hui Chun"]
Treats male dampness leading to impotence, inability to perform during intimate encounters.

Grind into a coarse powder, with five qian of this mixture boiled in three bowls of water until reducing to one and a half bowls, and warm wash the moist areas and scrotum twice daily; rewarm the water for additional washings, which is particularly beneficial.[171p]

　　乌龙丸 【《本事方》】 　一名乌头丸，治肾脏风下注，生疮癣。　　川乌　草乌各一两，以黑豆半升煮透软，去皮脐，切，晒干　大白附子　天麻　地龙各五钱　　右为末，酒糊和丸梧子大，空心盐汤吞下三五十丸。
　　椒粉散 【《东垣十书》】 　治阴囊湿痒。　　麻黄根二钱　黑狗脊即贯众　蛇床子各一钱　川椒　当归梢　猪苓各六分　螌蝥四枚　轻粉　红花各少许　　右为末，干掺，避风冷。

　　茴香楝实丸 【《丹溪心法》】 　治男子七疝，妇人带下瘕聚，痛不可忍，皆任脉所主，治法同焉。　　川楝子炒　茴香　山茱萸　吴茱萸　食茱萸　青皮　陈皮　马蔺花　芫花各一两　　右为末，酢糊和丸梧子大，温酒下五十丸。[175p]

Frankincense and Dragon Bone Powder: Used to treat external kidney dampness, itching, and decay. Ingredients include Dragon Bone, Gypsum, and Wubeizi (each 2.5 qian), Bai Ji, Frankincense, and Huang Dan (each 1.25 qian), and a little Musk. Grind into a fine powder, and first decoct Sophora flavescens, Trichosanthes, and Perilla leaves to wash with warm water before applying.

Wulong Pill: Also called Wutou Pill, used to treat kidney wind descending, causing sores and eczema. Ingredients include Chuanwu and Caowu (each 1 liang), black beans (half sheng) boiled until soft and skinned, sliced, and dried; Dabaifuzi, Tianma, and Dilu (each 5 qian). Grind into a fine powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of a jujube, and swallow 30 to 50 pills with salty warm water.

Pepper Powder: Used to treat damp itching of the scrotum. Ingredients include Mahuang root (2 qian), Heigouji (Guanzhong), and Shechuangzi (each 1 qian), Chuanjiao, Danggui tips, and Zhuling (each 6 fen), four pieces of Qianmiao, and a little Qingfen and Honghua. Grind into a fine powder, dry mix, and avoid wind and cold.

Fennel and Melia Fruit Pill: Used to treat seven types of hernias in men, and women's leukorrhea and masses causing unbearable pain, all governed by the Ren meridian, treated similarly. Ingredients include fried Chuanlianzi, Fennel, Shan Zhao Yu, Wu Zhao Yu, Shi Zhao Yu, Qingpi, Chenpi, Malin flowers, and Yuanhua (each 1 liang). Grind into a fine powder, mix with vinegar to form pills the size of a jujube, and take 50 pills with warm wine.[175p]

　　木香金铃丸 【《古今医鉴》】 　治诸般疝气，及外肾肿胀痛，一服立应。　　乳香　没药　木香　附子炮　茴香盐炒　川楝肉　延胡索　全蝎炒　人参各等分　　右为末，酒糊和丸，梧子大，空心黄酒下百丸。
　　丁香楝实丸 【《医学纲目》】 　治男子七疝，女子瘕聚带下。　　当归　附子炮　川楝肉　茴香各一两，并銼，好酒三升，煮酒尽为度，焙作细末，每末一两入　丁香　木香各二钱　全蝎十三个　延胡索一两　　右并为末，与前药拌匀，酒糊和丸梧子大，空心，酒下百丸，凡疝气带下，皆属于风。全蝎治风之圣药，川楝、茴香皆入小肠经，当归、延胡索和血止痛。疝气带下，皆积寒邪于小肠之间，故以附子佐之，丁香、木香为引导也。有人患疝痛三年，服此三剂良愈。[176p]

Wood Fragrance Golden Bell Pill: Treats various kinds of hernias and external kidney swelling and pain. One dose should take effect immediately. Contains equal parts of: frankincense, myrrh, wood fragrance, prepared aconite, salt-fried fennel, chuan lian fruit, yan hu suo, pan fried scorpion, and ginseng. Grind these into powder, mix with wine paste to form pills the size of a walnut, taken with hollow yellow wine, a hundred pills.

Clove Lian Fruit Pill: Treats male hernias and female masses with abnormal discharge. Ingredients include: one tael of angelica, prepared aconite, chuan lian fruit, and fennel, along with three sheng of good wine, boiled down to measure, then roasted into fine powder. For each tael of this powder, add two qian of clove and wood fragrance, thirteen whole scorpions, and one tael of yan hu suo. Mix these thoroughly, and with the previous medicines, form pills the size of a walnut, hollow, taken with wine, a hundred pills. All hernias with discharge are related to wind. Whole scorpion is a master medicine for wind; chuan lian and fennel enter the small intestine meridian, while angelica and yan hu suo stop pain by invigorating the blood. Hernias and discharges are due to cold evil accumulating in the small intestine, thus aconite is used to assist, and clove and wood fragrance serve as guides. There are cases of people suffering from hernia pain for three years; taking three doses of this has led to good recovery.[176p]

　　四炒川楝丸 【《医学入门》，下同】 　治一切疝气肿痛缩小，久服断根。　　川楝肉一斤，作四分：一分用麸一合，螌蝥四十九枚，同炒；一分用麸一合，巴戟一两，同炒；一分用麸一合，巴豆四十九枚，同炒；一分用盐一两，茴香一合，同炒。并以麸黄色为度，拣去同炒药，只取川楝肉　再加木香、破故纸炒各一两为末，酒糊和丸梧子大，每五十丸，盐汤下，日三服。
　　五炒川楝丸　治诸疝。
　　川楝肉五两。将一两螌蝥三个，同炒；一两茴香三钱五分，同炒；一两黑　三钱，同炒；一两破故纸三钱，同炒，一两萝卜子一钱，同炒。拣去同炒药，只留茴香、破故纸、川楝肉为末　酒糊和丸梧子大，温酒下五十丸。
　　乌附通气汤　治新久疝病，四气七情疝，皆效。　　乌药　香附子　当归　白芍药　山楂肉　橘皮各一钱　赤茯苓　泽泻各五分　猪苓　木香　甘草各三分　白朮七分　　右銼，作一贴，水煎，空心服。[177p]

Four-Fried Chan Lian Pills

Treats all types of hernias, abdominal swelling and pain, and reduces their size; long-term use will root out the issue.

Use one pound of Chan Lian flesh, divided into four parts:

  • One part with one cup of wheat bran, and forty-nine cockroaches, stir-fried together.
  • One part with one cup of wheat bran, and one tael of Ba Jiao, stir-fried together.
  • One part with one cup of wheat bran, and forty-nine Ba Dou, stir-fried together.
  • One part with one tael of salt, and one cup of fennel, stir-fried together.

Ensure the wheat bran turns yellow; remove other stir-fried ingredients, and use only Chan Lian flesh. Add one tael each of Mu Xiang and Po Gu Zhi, stir-fry until ground, and mix with wine to form pills the size of a jujube. Take fifty pills with salt water, three times a day.

Five-Fried Chan Lian Pills

Treats various hernias.

Use half a pound of Chan Lian flesh.

  • Stir-fry one tael of cockroaches (three pieces).
  • Stir-fry one tael of fennel (three and a half qian).
  • Stir-fry one tael of black (three qian).
  • Stir-fry one tael of Po Gu Zhi (three qian).
  • Stir-fry one tael of radish seeds (one qian).

Remove the stir-fried items, keeping fennel, Po Gu Zhi, and Chan Lian flesh to grind into a powder. Mix with wine to form pills the size of a jujube, and take fifty pills with warm wine.

Wu Fu Tong Qi Decoction

Treats both new and chronic hernia diseases, effective for all types of hernias related to the four energies and seven emotions.

Ingredients:

  • Wu Yao, Xiang Fu Zi, Dang Gui, Bai Shao Yao (each one qian)
  • Chi Fu Ling, Ze Xie (each five fen)
  • Zhu Ling, Mu Xiang, Gan Cao (each three fen)
  • Bai Zhu (seven fen)

Grind together to make a paste, decoct in water, and take on an empty stomach.[177p]

Shí Wèi Cāng Kè Sǎn - Treats damp heat hernia pain.
Cāng Zhú, Huáng Bó, Xiāng Fù Zǐ each one qian; Qīng Pí, Yán Hú Suǒ, Yì Zhì Rén, Táo Rén each seven fen; Huí Xiāng (fried), Fù Zǐ (processed), Gān Cǎo each five fen. Grind together to make one dose, taken on an empty stomach, boiled in water.

Shén Xiāo Sǎn (from "Ancient and Modern Medical Insights") - Treats all types of hernias, external kidney swelling and pain. Yì Zhì Rén (fried) seven qian; Shān Zhǐ Rén (salt-water fried until black), Jǐ Hè (fried), Huí Xiāng (salt-water fried) each one liang; Lì Zhī Hè eight qian; Bīng Láng five qian; Qīng Pí (oil fried) three qian. Grind into powder, take two qian mixed with burning liquor on an empty stomach; if not drinking liquor, take with salted water.

Yù Dú Tāng - Treats small intestine wind, itch and pain of yin sores.
Mù Tōng, Jiāo Běn, Zhǐ Hé, Guàn Zhòng, Jīng Jiè, Gān Sōng, Bò Hé, Bái Zhǐ; crush these, use two liang of the medicine, five sheng of water, add half a liang of Máng Xiāo, boil down to three sheng, discard the residue, and use hot to wash the sores.

Qīng Xīn Lián Zǐ Yǐn - Treats the retreat of hanging sores, with only red and painful urination.
Huáng Qín five qian; Huáng Qí (honey-fried), Shí Lián Ròu (heart removed), Rén Shēn, Chì Fú Líng each seven qian and a half; Chē Qián Zǐ (fried), Mài Mén Dōng (heart removed), Gān Cǎo (fried), Dì Gǔ Pí, processed Gān Cǎo; each dose is one liang, with two zhōng of water, boiled down to eight parts, to be taken before meals. If there is fever, add Chái Hú and Bò Hé.[178p]

　　加味托里散　治悬痈不消不溃。
　　人参　黄芪盐水拌炒　当归酒拌　麦门冬　川芎　知母酒拌炒　黄蘗酒拌炒　芍药炒　柴胡　金银花　制甘草各一钱　　右作一剂，用水二锺，煎八分，食前服。
　　加味十全大补汤　治悬痈溃而不敛，或发热，饮食少思。　　人参　黄芪盐水拌炒　白朮炒　茯苓　川芎　熟地黄酒蒸　当归酒拌　白芍药炒，各一钱　肉桂　麦门冬　甘草炒　五味子捣炒，各五分　　右作一剂，用水二锺，煎一锺，食前服。茎肿加青皮，热加黄芩、柴胡，日晡热加柴胡、地骨皮，小便赤加酒制知母、黄蘗，小便濇加车前子、山栀子俱炒。
　　肾脏风方　凡指缝白者，只一二服效。　　黄芪一两　木通　甘草　黑牵牛各半两　　右四味，细銼，用螌蝥七枚，去翅，同药炒焦黑，去螌蝥，余为末，蒸饼糊为丸如桐子大，空心盐汤下三十丸。[179p]

Jiawei Tori San treats abscesses that do not heal or rupture.

Ingredients:

  • Ginseng
  • Astragalus (saltwater sautéed)
  • Angelica (sautéed with wine)
  • Ophiopogon
  • Chuanxiong
  • Anemarrhena (sautéed with wine)
  • Berberis (sautéed with wine)
  • Peony (sautéed)
  • Bupleurum
  • Honeysuckle
  • Processed licorice, each at one penny.

Preparation: Combine these into one dose, use two pints of water, simmer down to eight tenths, and take before meals.

Jiawei Shiquan Dabu Tang treats abscesses that rupture but do not heal, or may cause fever, reduced appetite, and mental distress.

Ingredients:

  • Ginseng
  • Astragalus (saltwater sautéed)
  • Atractylodes (sautéed)
  • Poria
  • Chuanxiong
  • Rehmannia (steamed with wine)
  • Angelica (sautéed with wine)
  • White peony (sautéed), each at one penny
  • Cinnamon
  • Ophiopogon
  • Licorice (sautéed)
  • Schisandra (crushed and sautéed), each at half a penny.

Preparation: Combine these into one dose, use two pints of water, simmer down to one pint, and take before meals. If there is swelling, add Qingpi; if feverish, add Huangqin and Chaihu; if fever increases in the afternoon, add Chaihu and Di Gu Pi. For red urine, add prepared Anemarrhena and Berberis; for turbid urine, add Plantago seeds and Gardenia, both sautéed.

Shen Zang Feng Fang: For those with white in the spaces between the fingers, only one or two doses will be effective.

Ingredients:

  • Astragalus (one ounce)
  • Mutong
  • Licorice
  • Black morning glory (each at half an ounce).

Preparation: Grind these four ingredients finely, use seven centipedes (remove wings), and fry them with the herbs until charred black. Remove the centipedes, and make the remaining mixture into pills the size of tung seeds, to be taken with thirty pills in saline soup.[179p]

　　全蝎散　治肾脏风发疮痒。
　　全蝎三枚，焙　明硫黄二钱，研　生虢丹一钱　槟榔一大个，破开，用好黄丹一钱合内，湿纸裹煨　麝香少许，研　轻粉半钱　　右为细末，研匀，磁盒收，每用少许，麻油调抹两掌，先以鼻嗅，男以两掌揜外肾，女以两掌揜两乳，各睡至醒，次日依前再用药，屡效。
　　牡蛎散　治阴囊两旁生疮，或阴湿出水，其痒甚苦，夜则抓之无足，后必自痛；或两腋汗，脚板心汗湿，无可奈何，此药主之。予亲得此证，受苦数十年，得此方，随用一二日，如法擦之，二十余年不发，实为神效。　　牡蛎　黄丹炒，各二两　枯白矾四两　　右为细末，遇夜睡时，用手捏药于阴痒处痛擦之；不一时，又搽之三四次，后顿减。次夜，再搽，虽大减，又搽，后自然平复。如腋汗亦有顿搽方。如脚汗，先搽，后装药于靴或鞋底上，脚板上涂药缠脚裹之，亦可。古今图书集成医部全录卷二百三[180p]

Whole Scorpion Powder: Treats itching from wind eruptions in the kidneys.
Take three whole scorpions, bake them, and mix two qian of prepared sulfur. Grind one qian of raw realgar and one large betel nut, breaking it open. Combine this with one qian of good yellow dan. Wrap in damp paper and steam with a small amount of musk. Grind half a qian of light powder. All of these should become a fine powder, mixed well, and stored in a magnetic box. Use a small amount each time by mixing it with flaxseed oil and applying it to both palms. First, smell it with the nose; for men, cover the outer kidneys with both palms, and for women, cover both breasts. Sleep until waking, then repeat the application the next day to see repeated effects.

Oyster Powder: Treats sores on both sides of the scrotum, or wetness leading to itching, causing great distress, especially at night when scratching offers no relief, followed by pain; or if there is sweating under the arms, or sweaty soles with no resolution, this medicine is the solution. I personally experienced this condition for several decades, suffering greatly and then found this formula. After using it for one or two days as directed, I had relief for over twenty years, truly miraculous.
Take oysters and prepared yellow dan, each two liang; and four liang of dry white alum. Grind all into a fine powder. At night, while sleeping, knead the medicine onto the itchy pain area in the groin. After a short time, apply it three or four more times, leading to significant reduction. The following night, apply again; even if much improved, continue applying until it naturally stabilizes. For excessive sweating under the arms, a direct application is advisable. For foot sweating, first apply the powder, then place the medicine in boots or on the soles of shoes, applying the medicine to the feet and wrapping them as well.[180p]

　　人参酒 【《千金方》，下同】 　治交接过度，或病未平复交接，伤气筋绝，舌卷唇青，引卵缩，胻脉疼急，腹中绞痛欲绝，不能饮食。　　人参　防风　白茯苓　细辛　秦椒　黄芪　当归　牛膝　桔梗各一两半　丹参　干地黄　薯蓣　锺乳石　矾石　山萸　芎藭各二两　白朮　麻黄各二两五钱　大枣三十枚，擘开　五加皮一升　生姜切炒干　乌麻碎，各二升　　右二十二味，(口父)咀，锺乳别以小袋子盛，清酒二斗半，浸五宿，温服三合，日再。不知，随意增进。一本无乌麻，用杜仲一两半。[181p]

Front Genital Gate

Formula

Ginseng Wine: This is used to treat excessive sexual intercourse, or when the condition after intercourse has not yet stabilized, leading to injury of Qi, severe pain in the tendons, a rolled tongue and bluish lips, contracted testicles, painful abdominal cramps, and an inability to eat or drink.

Ingredients:

  • Ginseng: 1.5 taels

  • Siler: 1.5 taels

  • White Poria: 1.5 taels

  • Asarum: 1.5 taels

  • Sichuan Pepper: 1.5 taels

  • Astragalus: 1.5 taels

  • Angelica: 1.5 taels

  • Achyranthes: 1.5 taels

  • Platycodon: 1.5 taels

  • Salvia: 2 taels

  • Rehmannia (dried): 2 taels

  • Yam: 2 taels

  • Cuttlefish bone: 2 taels

  • Alum: 2 taels

  • Shan Yao: 2 taels

  • Ligusticum: 2 taels

  • Atractylodes: 2.5 taels

  • Ephedra: 2.5 taels

  • Jujubes: 30 pieces, split open

  • Five-Flavor Berry Peel: 1 sheng

  • Fresh Ginger: chopped and dry-fried, 2 sheng

  • Black Sesame: 2 sheng

Total: 22 ingredients. Grind and mix, putting the cuttlefish bone in a small bag. Soak in 2.5 dou of clear wine for five nights, then take 3 heaping bowls warm, twice daily. For those unsure, feel free to increase as desired. One version does not use black sesame, substituting with Eucommia 1.5 taels instead.[181p]

　　猪蹄汤　治服石发热，因劳损热盛，当风露卧，茎肿。　　猪蹄一只　蒴藋三升　蒺藜子研二升　葶苈子五合　黄蘗五两　　右五味，(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升，冷浴阴茎，日三。
　　葱白膏　治证同上。
　　葱白　松菜子　葶苈子　蒴藋根　蒺藜子　丹参各半升　猪膏五升　　右七味，(口父)咀，煎如煎膏法，去滓用之。
　　正阳散　治阴缩囊缩，大小便俱通，地道不塞，不渴不饮，邪不在里，宜温之灸之，外相接以复阳气。　　附子炮去皮脐　皂角酥炙，去皮弦，各一两　干姜炒　甘草炙，各二钱半　麝香一钱，研极细　　右为末，每服二钱，水一盏，煎五分，不拘时，和滓温服。[182p]

Pig’s Trotting Soup
Treats symptoms of stone heat due to overwork and heat accumulation. When resting in the wind and dew, swelling occurs.
Ingredients: One pig's trotter, three sheng of yellow vines, two sheng of spiny fruit (ziziphus), five he of water plantain seeds, five liang of yellow bitter.
Mix the five ingredients and grind them. Add one dou of water, and boil until three sheng remains. Use this liquid to bathe the penis three times daily.

Green Onion White Ointment
Treats the same symptoms as above.
Ingredients: Half sheng of green onion, half sheng of hemp seeds, half sheng of water plantain seeds, half sheng of yellow vine roots, half sheng of spiny fruit (ziziphus), half sheng of salvia. Five sheng of pig fat.
Mix the seven ingredients and grind them, then prepare like a fat decoction, removing the dregs for use.

Yang Restoration Powder
Treats contracted phallus and uplifts both urine and bowel movements without blockage. No thirst or desire to drink; if no evil is inside, warming and moxibustion are recommended to restore yang energy.
Ingredients: One liang of processed aconite, one liang of roasted soapberry, both skin and core removed; two and a half qian of stir-fried dry ginger; two and a half qian of charred licorice; one qian of fine powdered musk.
Grind the above into a fine powder. Take two qian with one cup of water, boil for five minutes, and take warm with dregs at any time.[182p]

　　立效散　治疝因食积作痛。

Little Bath Formula: For treating weakness, dampness, and itch leading to sores.

Ingredients:

  • 1.5 taels of each: Sichuan pepper, bitter root, snake bedseed
  • 1 tael each: white alum, white peony root, cyperus, dog spine, and asarum
  • 0.3 taels of cassia heart

Prepare by grinding them together. For each use, take 1 tael of the mixture, add 3 sheng of water, and boil down to 2 sheng. Strain the decoction and pour it into a basin. Sit over the basin to inhale the steam for a long time, prompting sweating all over. Then wash the affected area; usually, two or three exposures are sufficient.

Aloe Vera Pill (also known as Nine Ingredients Aloe Vera Pill): This pill treats excessive liver fire, external sores or ulcers, and painful swellings. It is also used for children with malnutrition, oral and nasal sores, and eroded gums, as well as for itch and pain caused by worms in the anus. These are ground into a powder, formed into pills the size of a tung seed, and taken with 1 qian on an empty stomach with rice drink.

Ba Zheng San: This formula treats external sores and infections, painful urination, and solid pulse symptoms. It consists of: 1 qian each of Dahuang, Cheqianzi, Qumaisui, Bianxu, Shan Zhizi, and Muxiang; 2 taels of Huashi; and 5 fen of Gan Cao. These are boiled with water for consumption.

Washing Detox Soup: This treats parasitic sores. The ingredients include equal parts of Ku Shen, Fang Feng, Conophytum, and roasted Gan Cao. These should be chewed, then boiled in water to create a concentrated solution for washing the sores.

Jin Yin Hua San: This treats sores from external infections. The ingredients are: 1 qian each of Jin Yin Hua, Jing Jie, Shibuxiao, She Chuang Zi, Gan Song, Bai Zhi, and Bing Lang. These should be chewed, mixed in a potion with 5 qian of the mixture in 5 bowls of water, along with 3 stalks of scallions, boiled until fragrant, and used for steaming and washing.

Jie Gan San: Treats long-standing sore lesions effectively.
Ingredients: Bai Ji, Bai Lian, Huang Dan, Mi Tuo Seng, each one liang; Bing Pian, She Xiang, each half qian; Huang Lian half liang; Qing Fen one qian.
Preparation: Grind into a fine powder and mix. Use by either sprinkling or inserting into the sore, then apply a medicated plaster.

Gan Shi San: Treats lower body sore lesions.
Ingredients: Lu Gan Shi, Mi Tuo Seng, each one and a half qian; Qing Fen one fen; burnt ash of Xiang Dou Zi, three qian; Long Gu half qian; a little She Xiang.
Preparation: Grind into a fine powder. First, decoct with Jing Jie, Du Zhong, and Chuan Jiao, then wash with the warm infusion. Next, apply a small amount of the medicine dry.

Bo Jin San: Treats lower sore lesions that are foul, rotten, swollen, and painful.
Ingredients: Bai Fan, Mi Tuo Seng, each five qian; ground together in a sand pot until the moisture evaporates; Bai Cha two qian; Ru Xiang five fen; She Xiang a small amount; Huang Dan, Qing Fen each one qian.
Preparation: Grind into a fine powder. First, use a separate decoction of Huai branches, green onion white, salt, and Gan Cao to wash the affected area for one or two sessions, dry it, then mix in the above remedies. Wash the area before applying the medicine, repeating up to three to five times until healing.

Sheng Jin San: Treats lower sore lesions that are ulcerated or painful.
Ingredients: Huang Lian, Huang Bo, Qing Fen, Yin Zhu, and Hai Er Cha, each five fen; Bing Pian one fen.
Preparation: Grind into a fine powder, mix with fragrant oil for topical application; for internal use, add to a modified Xiao Gan Tang.[190p]

　　双解散　治便痈内蕴热毒，外挟寒邪，或交感强固精气，致精血交错，肿结疼痛，大小便秘者，宜用此药通解，更随证调治。　　辣桂　大黄酒拌炒　白芍药　牵牛炒捣　桃仁去皮尖　泽泻　甘草炒　干姜炮，各五分　　右作一剂，水二锺，煎八分，空心服。

Shuangjiesan
This formula treats internal heat toxins manifested as carbuncles, accompanied by external cold pathogens, potentially causing a strong interaction of vital energy, leading to tangled essence and blood, swellings, and pain, as well as constipation. This medicine should be used to clear and resolve these symptoms, adjusting according to the condition.
Ingredients:

  • Dried ginger, prepared
  • Rhubarb, stir-fried with wine
  • White peony root
  • Qian Niu Zi, stir-fried and crushed
  • Peach kernel, peeled and pointed
  • Alisma
  • Licorice, stir-fried
  • Dried ginger, prepared, each five fen.
    Prepare one dose with two zhongs of water, decoct until reduced to eight parts, and take on an empty stomach.

Zhi Shen Wan
This formula treats deficiency of kidney yin in the lower jiao, urinary retention, weakness of the feet and knees, night sweats, impotence, or heat in the feet not allowing full contact with the ground, without thirst but with urinary retention.
Ingredients:

  • Coptis, washed with wine and roasted
  • Anemarrhena, washed with wine and roasted, each one tael
  • Cinnamon, two qian.
    Grind the above into a powder, form pills the size of a wutong seed, taking one hundred pills each time, increasing to two hundred pills, with hot water.

Oyster Powder

For treating blood hernias and venereal poison.

Ingredients:

  • Wine: 1.5 qian
  • Angelica: 1.5 qian
  • Licorice segments: 1.5 qian
  • Calcined talc: 1.5 qian
  • Calcined oyster: 1.5 qian
  • Rhubarb: 3 qian
  • Five seeds of Mume: 1.5 qian

Preparation:
Grind the ingredients into a powder. Use two cups of water, decoct until reduced to one cup, let it sit overnight, and take it at dawn. In winter, it should be taken warm.

Notes:
If the condition has not erupted, pus, and blood may discharge with stool. Xue Ji commented: This formula is an astringent and cold remedy for stagnation. If there is prolonged neglect of marital matters, constipation, fever, and burning pain, or strong engagement of vital energy, leading to complicated blood intertwining, swelling, pain, and constipation, it is advisable to use this remedy. Conversely, for individuals who are fatigued without significant swelling, having regular bowel habits, or exhibiting reddish and hot urine without purulence, and those whose wounds do not heal, it is better to use the Ten-Ingredient Great Tonifying Decoction. This condition often arises from insufficient labor or excessive sexual activity, leading to depletion of vital energy. A popular saying is: "One stone of rice sore," implying it can be cured after a hundred days.[195p]

若大补气血，不旬日而愈，何用百日？盖疮之收敛，在乎血气之盛也。尝治举人凌待之虚而服克伐药，几致危殆，予用托里健脾药而消。秀才王文远劳苦患之，服小柴胡汤而表证散，后用托里药，脓成针之，而旬日愈。胡判官脓清脉弱，以大补之药而已愈。因新婚复发，自用连翘消毒汤，致泻痢不止，竟致不救。可见此证属不足多矣，非补不可。大抵便毒属肝经，初起坚硬，肝主筋故也。五七日后，当赤软脓成，若尚坚硬，乃元气虚，不能腐化，往往人见坚硬，只欲内消，反服攻散药，以致虚虚之祸。前所治者，即其验也。　　又方　治便毒。[196p]

If one can greatly tonify the qi and blood, recovery can occur in a few days—why then require a hundred days? The healing of wounds depends on the abundance of qi and blood. I once treated a scholar named Ling Daizhi who suffered from deficiency and took harmful medications, nearly resulting in a critical state. I prescribed a remedy to strengthen his spleen, and he recovered. Scholar Wang Wenyuan suffered from labor and ailments, took Xiao Chaihu Decoction, which resolved exterior symptoms, and later used my remedy to drain and treated the abscess, recovering in several days. Judge Hu had clear pus and weak veins; he only used tonifying medicine and was healed. However, after recently marrying, he relapsed and self-administered a detoxifying decoction, leading to uncontrolled diarrhea and ultimately death. This illustrates that such conditions are often due to insufficiency and must be tonified. Generally, pustules belong to the liver meridian; initially, they are firm and hard due to the liver's dominance over the tendons. After five to seven days, they should become red and soft with pus; if still hard, it indicates deficiency of the original qi, unable to decompose. Often, people see hardness and only want to remove it internally, inadvertently taking aggressive herbs that lead to further deficiency. The previously mentioned cases are examples of this issue.

Additionally, here is a prescription for treating pustules.[196p]

Qingpi Decoction - Treats bowel toxicity.
Qingpi, Fangfeng, Donggui root, and Gan cao sprouts, all in equal parts. Grind, divide into four doses, boil in one small bowl of water until reduced to 80%, strain, and take warm on an empty stomach, three doses daily.

Fuyuan Tongqi Powder - Useful for the initial onset of bowel toxicity.
Nanmuxiang, Yanhusuo, Tianhuafen soaked in alcohol, Stir-fried Huoxiang, Stir-fried Baiqian, Bai Zhi, Donggui tail, Sheng Gan cao, each one liang; Qingmuxiang half a liang; and two liang of Pangolin soaked in alcohol until charred. Lou Powder - Treats bowel sores and other grievous ulcers.
One piece of Lou, Jin yin hua, and Stir-fried Niubangzi, each three qian; Sheng Jiang and Gan cao, each half a liang. Crush the herbs without using copper or iron tools, use one large sheng of wine, boil until bubbling, and take warm on an empty stomach.

Zhui Poison Powder - Treats swollen lumps from bowel toxicity.
Pangolin, charred and dipped in vinegar, five qian; Wood pig kidneys, slightly charred in vinegar, three qian. Grind into powder, take two qian before meals mixed with old wine, then apply a paste of soap boiled with vinegar. Excellent. Wood pig kidneys refer to Mudanling.[198p]

　　威灵仙散　治便毒。
　　威灵仙　贝母　知母各一两
　　右三味为末，每服三钱，空心温酒调下。如不散，再服。薛己曰：按此方通经去脓，消毒，补虚益气，盖此证多患于阴虚之人，此方乃是一见也。亦有焮痛小便数者，宜用加减龙胆泻肝汤；大小便秘，焮肿作痛，宜八正散；憎寒发热，荆防败毒散。然后用此方。若不作脓，或脓不溃，宜用大补之剂。溃而不敛者，更用豆豉饼灸之。[199p]

Dissolve the poison and swelling like magic.

Fry scorpions, use walnut meat without the shell, only the membrane, fry it and grind it into powder, then mix with empty hollow wine and take three qian in the afternoon; after three days, you will be fully recovered.

Application method for treating poisonous swelling and pain.

Two liang of realgar and frankincense, one liang of berberine. Grind these into fine powder, mix with freshly drawn water to apply, and the swelling will naturally dissipate.

Another formula for treating poison.

Equal parts of ground frankincense and myrrh, half a liang each of rhubarb, coptis, berberine, pinellia, saposhnikovia, notopterygium, soapberry thorn, or bitter gourd seeds, licorice root knot, aconite, fried ejiao, and nux vomica. Grind these into fine powder, mix with vinegar to form a paste, place it in a stone container, and heat until black. Use an egret feather to apply.

Weilingxian powder treats poison.

One liang each of weilingxian, fritillaria, and anemarrhena. Grind these three ingredients into powder, and take three qian each time, mixing with warm wine. If it doesn't dispel the condition, take it again.

Xue Ji said: This formula promotes the flow of qi, expels pus, dispels toxins, and nourishes deficiency and boosts energy. It is mainly suited for those who suffer from yin deficiency. This formula is intended for immediate use.

If there is frequent painful urination, it's advisable to use a modified version of Long Dan Cao's liver-clearing decoction; for constipation with painful swelling, use Ba Zheng San; for chills and fever, use Jing Fang Bai Du San. Then apply this formula.

If there is no pus or if the pus does not drain, it is recommended to use a nourishing formula. If it drains but does not close, apply a moxa on fermented bean cake.[199p]

Weiling Powder: Treats toxic stools.
Ingredients: Pig's ears, ZeXie, BaiZhu, FuLing, CangZhu, HouPo, ChenPi each one qian; GanCao (roasted) and RouGui each five fen. Prepare as one dose, with two zhōng of water, three slices of ginger, and two jujubes, simmer until reduced to eight parts, then take.

Jinbai Powder for treating sores:
Lead powder, quantity not restricted, tilt over silver nest to remove lead, use eight qian; QingFen three qian; BingPian three fen. Grind into a powder, apply a small amount to the affected area. First wash with tea, then use the medicine.

Sores Powder:
Dengxin ash two qian, QingFen two qian, BingPian one fen, grind into powder, apply to the affected area. For swelling and hardening like a pipe, strip rough skin from sour jujube tree, simmer the inner white skin in water to wash, then apply medicine.

Another formula:
Sea crab burned ash, three qian; Hai'er tea two qian; QingFen one qian; PianNao one fen; HuangBo powder five fen, grind into powder and apply to the affected area.

Another formula:
Wash and cleanse snail shells that have decayed on the wall, calcine, five qian; QingFen three qian; PianNao one fen, grind into powder and apply to the affected area.

Jealousy sores formula:
Hai'er tea and HuangDan each two qian; HuangLian and ChiShiZhi each one qian; ZhuSha four fen; QingFen three fen; HuangBo six fen; PianNao one fen, grind into powder, mix with three liang of fresh pig oil (removing residue), apply to the affected area, and cover with bitter vegetable leaves.[200p]

　　川楝子丸　治疝气，一切下部之疾，悉皆治之。肿痛缩小虽多年，服此药，永去根本。　　川楝子净肉一斤，分四处：四两用麸一合、螌蝥四十九个同炒麸黄色，去麸螌蝥不用；四两用麸一合、巴豆四十九粒同炒麸黄色，去麸、巴豆不用；四两用麸一合、巴戟一两同炒麸黄色，去麸巴戟不用；四两用盐一两、川茴香一合同炒黄色，去盐茴香不用　木香不见火　破故纸炒香为度，各一两　　右为末，酒糊丸如梧子大，每服五十丸，盐汤下，甚者日进三两服，空心食前。
　　沉香桂附丸 【《卫生宝鉴》】 　疗七疝痛引小腹，不可忍，腰屈不能伸，热熨稍缓。　　沉香　附子炮去皮脐　山乌炮去皮脐　官桂　干姜炮　高良姜炒　吴茱萸热汤浸去苦　茴香炒，各一两　　右研为末，酢煮面糊为丸如桐子大，每服五十丸至七八十丸，食前米饮下，日二。忌生冷。[201p]

Chuan Lian Zi Wan is used to treat hernias and all ailments in the lower body, all of which can be cured. Even if swelling and pain have persisted for many years, taking this medicine will eliminate the root cause forever.

For preparation, take one pound of cleaned Chuan Lian Zi, divided into four portions: use four ounces with one drachm of wheat bran and fry with forty-nine grasshoppers until the bran turns yellow, then discard the bran and grasshoppers; use four ounces with one drachm of castor beans and fry the same way; use four ounces with one drachm of Ba Jiao and also fry; use four ounces with one ounce of salt and one drachm of Chuan Huixiang in the same manner, then discard the salt and Huixiang.

Do not apply heat to Mu Xiang; instead, fry old paper until fragrant, using one ounce of each.

Grind all of the above into a fine powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of a wutong seed. Take fifty pills at a time, swallowed with salty broth, and for severe cases, up to three doses a day on an empty stomach before meals.

Chen Xiang Gui Fu Wan is for the treatment of seven types of hernia pain that radiates to the lower abdomen, causing unbearable discomfort; the waist may bend and cannot straighten, relief can be managed with heat.

The ingredients include: Chen Xiang, Fu Zi (prepared), Shan Wu (prepared), Guan Gui, Gan Jiang (prepared), Gao Liang Jiang (fried), Wu Zhu Yu (soaked in hot water to remove bitterness), and Huixiang (fried), each at one ounce.

Grind these into a powder, and mix with vinegar to make a paste for pills the size of a tung seed. Take fifty to seventy or eighty pills before meals with rice wine, twice daily. Avoid raw and cold foods.[201p]

Ding Xiang Shan Qi Wan
Treats kidney hernia.
Dang Gui, fennel, each one liang; Yan Hu Suo, and Gan Cao Shao, each five qian; Qiang Huo seven and a half fen; Ma Huang Gen Jie, Ding Xiang, Chuan Wu, Rou Gui, Fang Ji, each two and a half qian; Quan Xie thirty pieces.
Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of peas. Take fifty pills each time, washed down with light salt water or warm wine, on an empty stomach after previous meal has digested.

Chuan Ku Lian San
Treats (hereditary) hernia.
Chuan Lian Zi, finely chopped, use ten seeds of Ba Dou, crushed, stir-fried until browned and remove Ba Dou. Add one spoon of fennel salt, stir-fried until browned, and remove salt. Mu Xiang, each one liang.
Grind the above into a fine powder, take two qian each time, before meals on an empty stomach, mixed with warm wine.

Mu Xiang Lian Zi San
Treats small intestine hernia, bladder prolapse. For those who have not responded to medicine after a long time, this remedy is effective.
Thirty pieces of Chuan Lian Zi, twenty pieces of Ba Dou, stir-fried until yellowish-red, remove Ba Dou. Half a liang of Bi Xie, Shi Chang Pu stir-fried, Qing Mu Xiang each one liang, stir-fried, twenty pieces of Lychee seed, stir-fried.
Grind the above into a fine powder, take two qian each time, with a little musk added, mixed with stir-fried fennel salt wine, taken on an empty stomach.[202p]

　　乌头桂枝汤 【《金匮要略》，下同】 　治寒疝。　　桂枝去皮　芍药　生姜各三两　甘草炙，二两　大枣十二枚，擘　　右用乌头一味，以蜜二斤，煎减半，去滓，以桂枝汤五合解之，得一升后，初服二合，不知，即服三合；又不知，复加至五合。其知者，如醉状得吐者为中病。
　　乌头煎
　　乌头大者五枚，熬去皮，不(口父)咀　　右以水三升，煮取一升，去滓，纳蜜二升，煎令水气尽，取二升，强人服七合，弱人五合。不瘥，明日更服。又不可，日再服。
　　胡卢巴丸 【《和剂》】 　治小肠疝气，偏坠阴肿，小腹有形如卵，上下来去，痛不可忍，或绞结绕脐，攻刺呕吐闷乱。　　胡卢巴炒，一斤　茴香盐炒，十二两　吴茱萸洗炒，十两　川楝子去核炒，一斤二两　巴戟去心炒　川乌炮，去皮脐，各六两　　右为末，酒糊丸桐子大，每服十五丸至二十丸，空心温酒下。小儿五丸，茴香汤下。一方有黑牵牛。[203p]

Wutou Guizhi Decoction (from "Jinkui Yaolue," same below)
For treating cold hernias.
Guizhi (cinnamon twig) peeled, Shaoyao (peony root), fresh ginger, each 3 liang; honey-fried licorice, 2 liang; 12 jujubes, smashed.
Use Wutou (aconite root) alone, 1 type, with 2 jin of honey, boil down to half, strain, and dissolve with 5 he of Guizhi Decoction. After obtaining 1 sheng, initially take 2 he; if unknown, take 3 he; again unknown, increase to 5 he. In those who are aware, if they appear drunk and vomit, it signifies a middle disease.

Wutou Decoction
Five large Wutou pieces, skin removed, unchewed.
Use 3 sheng of water, boil to extract 1 sheng, strain, add 2 sheng of honey, boil until the moisture is gone, retain 2 sheng. Strong individuals can take 7 he, weak individuals 5 he. If not healed, take it again the next day. If unable to take, repeat twice daily.

Hulu Ba Pills (from "Heji")
For treating small intestine hernias, with descent of Yin swelling, a mass in the lower abdomen resembling an egg, moving up and down, causing intolerable pain, or tied up around the navel, leading to vomiting and unrest.
One jin of roasted Hulu Ba (cucumber seeds), 12 liang of roasted fennel salt, 10 liang of washed and roasted Wuzhuyu (evodia fruit), 1 jin 2 liang of roasted Chuanlianzizi (melia fruit) with pits removed, 6 liang each of heart-removed Ba Jizhi (morinda root) and prepared Chuanwu (prepared aconite).
Grind these into powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of tung seeds, take 15 to 20 pills each time, downed with warm wine on an empty stomach. For children, take 5 pills downed with fennel soup. One formula includes black Qian Niu.[203p]

Spiny Ginger Decoction [from "Hygiene Treasure"]
For treating inguinal hernia, pulling pain in the lower abdomen. All forms of hernia, namely inguinal hernia. If one engages in physical labor, it results in unbearable pain.

Fried spiny ginger, thorns removed;
Prepared aconite root with skin and navel removed;
Each equal measure of mountain gardenia seeds.

Grind these into a powder. Take three qian with one and a half bowls of water, decoct until reduced to seven parts, and take warm before meals.

Danxi Recipe
For treating cold and hot hernias.

Equal parts of tangerine seeds, peach kernels, gardenia, evodia, and chuanwu.

Grind together and decoct in water to take.

Another Recipe
For urgent hernia pain.

Salt-fried herbs: astragalus, cyperus;
Fried fennel as an addition;
Corydalis, wine-fried as the main ingredient;
Qingpi with pulp removed and fried with bran;
Yi Zhi Ren and peach kernels as attendants;
Aconite fried in salt water;
Licorice as a guide.

Grind into a powder to make a decoction. If taken, after one pain attack, there will be no further pain.[204p]

Cangcu San (also known as Zhifu Decoction) is used to treat sudden abdominal pain due to cold hernia and for conditions affecting the small intestine and bladder with stabbing pain. When the spleen and kidney's qi attacks suddenly, resulting in unbearable pain, inability to bend or stretch, and a cold, heavy sensation in the abdomen akin to a stone, with white fluid excretion.

Ingredients: 49 pieces of mountain gardenia, burned until half done; 1 piece of aconite, processed;
Take 2 qian (a traditional weight unit) of the right powder, mix with 1 cup of water and half a cup of wine, decoct until reduced to 7 parts, add a pinch of salt, and take it warm for immediate relief.

Muxiang Daqi Wan treats men’s abdominal pain due to small intestine qi and all kinds of qi accumulation, replenishing the lower source's cold deficiency.

Ingredients: 1 liang (another traditional weight unit) each of wood incense, frankincense, and kernel-free flos fraxini; star anise, fennel, clove, cyperus, broken old paper, and hu lu ba; 3 leng (another herb), 1 liang of licorice; half a liang of duzhong, fried and stripped of silk.
Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of a wutong seed; take 30 pills, increasing to 50 as needed, using warm wine or salty soup to wash them down, taken three times a day.

Bushan Tang is used for cold hernia entering the abdomen, small intestine pain, and recurrent diarrhea, as well as chest distention.

Ingredients: 5 fen (a smaller weight) of agarwood; 1.5 qian each of ginseng, poria, processed aconite (skin and navel removed), astragalus, white atractylodes, and papaya; 1 qian each of qianghuo, angelica, perilla, and roasted licorice.
These should be prepared as one dose with 2 zhong of water, 3 slices of ginger, and 1 red date, decocted for 1 zhong and consumed before meals. For vomiting, add 1 qian of pinellia and 7 slices of fresh ginger to decoct and consume.[205p]

　　敌金丸　治疝气外肾肿胀极大，或生疮出黄水，其痛绕腹，寒热往来。　　京三棱煨　蓬朮煨　猪苓　白附子　萝卜子　赤芍药　黑牵牛　川楝子　山茵陈　青木香　陈橘皮　五灵脂　海藻酒浸焙　小蘹香　穿山甲灰火煨焦　姜黄各一两　泽泻一两半　海浮石酢浸煅红酢淬，再煅再淬，黑色为度，一两　青皮去白，二两。一两生用；一两銼，以螌蝥五十枚去头足翅，同炒黄色，去螌蝥不用　南木香半两　香附子净，二两。一两生用；一两以巴豆五十粒去壳同炒色焦，去巴豆不用　丁香二钱半　　右为细末，酒煮缅糊为丸，如梧子大，每服二十丸，用温酒下。此药能泄，斟酌用之。[206p]

Enemy Gold Pill treats hernias and greatly swollen external kidneys, or those that produce sores with yellow discharge, accompanied by pain around the abdomen, with alternating cold and heat.

Ingredients:

  • 3 qian of vertex (San Leng) roasted
  • 3 qian of Poria (Fu Ling) roasted
  • 3 qian of Polyporus (Zhu Ling)
  • 3 qian of White Aconite (Bai Fu Zi)
  • 3 qian of Radish seeds (Luo Bo Zi)
  • 3 qian of Red Peony (Chi Shao Yao)
  • 3 qian of Black Morning Glory seeds (Hei Qian Niu)
  • 3 qian of Sichuan Chenopodium (Chuan Lian Zi)
  • 3 qian of Mountain Euphorbia (Shan Yin Chen)
  • 3 qian of Green Cardamom (Qing Mu Xiang)
  • 3 qian of Aged Tangerine Peel (Chen Ju Pi)
  • 3 qian of Myrrh (Wu Ling Zhi)
  • 3 qian of Seaweed (Hai Zao) soaked in wine and roasted
  • 3 qian of Lesser Cardamom (Xiao Yan Xiang)

  • 2 liang of Green Tangerine Peel (Qing Pi) with the white part removed
  • 1 liang raw; and 1 liang ground with 50 centipedes, removing heads, feet, and wings, fried until yellow, discarding centipedes

  • 2 liang of Cyperus (Xiang Fu Zi), with 1 liang raw and 1 liang fried with 50 peeled seeds of Croton, until charred, discarding Croton
  • 2.5 qian of Cloves (Ding Xiang)

　　腰子散，治肾气作痛。
　　黑牵牛炒熟　白牵牛炒熟，等分
　　右为细末，每用三钱，猪腰子一对，薄切开缝，入川椒五十粒，茴香一百粒，以牵牛末遍掺于腰子中，线扎，湿纸数重裹煨，香熟取出，放地上出火气，灯后，空心嚼吃，好酒送下，少顷就枕，天明，取下恶物，即愈。[207p]

Yaozi San, for treating painful kidney qi.
Fried black morning glory and fried white morning glory, equal parts.
Grind them into a fine powder. For each use, take three qian, and for one pair of pig kidneys, cut them thin and stitch them together. Add fifty grains of Sichuan pepper and one hundred grains of fennel, mixing the morning glory powder evenly into the kidneys. Tie them with thread, wrap them in damp paper several times, and stew until fragrant and cooked. Take them out to release steam, chew hollowly while drinking good wine. After a while, rest, and by dawn, remove the foul substance, and you will be cured.[207p]

Prescription for Kidney Pain
For the treatment of men's kidney qi and women's blood qi, when the pain becomes unbearable, with a blue face and black lips, nearly to the point of no return. For men, this attacks the organs, causing pain in the lower back; for women, it forms lumps in the abdomen, leading to sudden pain that can be dangerously debilitating, with pain persisting year after year. Those experiencing this pain should take this remedy.

Ingredients:

  • Dong Quai (Angelica sinensis) 1 qian
  • White Peony 1 qian
  • Myrrh
  • Qilin Grass
  • Corydalis
  • Poria
  • Three-Lobed Bletilla
  • Cowherb, boiled and roasted dry 1/2 liang
  • Wood Fragrance 1/2 liang
  • Wolf Poison 1/2 liang, crushed
  • Cynanchum 4 liang, combined with Wolf Poison, stir-fried until yellow

Preparation: First, process the Cynanchum and Wolf Poison, grinding them into a paste in a mortar. Then, combine Qilin Grass and others, grinding them into a fine powder. Lastly, mix the powders of Cynanchum, Wolf Poison, Qilin Grass, Myrrh, and others, grinding thousands of times. Each serving is 1.5 qian, taken with green onion wine during episodes of qi pain. Do not consume after a full meal. If there is severe heat in the intestines, and one is unable to pass stool, with blackened lips and excessive salivation, taking this remedy once is effective.

First Prescription
Take half a tael of salt to fry the imported fennel until it turns yellow and then mix it with a weighed amount of sand ginseng and one tael each of prepared bitter orange and wood fragrance. Grind them into a fine powder, then combine with rice paste to form pills the size of a tung seed. Take twenty pills each time, on an empty stomach, with warm wine or salty broth, three times a day. For minor ailments, this dose should suffice. If symptoms persist, proceed to the second prescription.

Second Prescription
Add one tael of prickly ash and half a tael of betel nut to the previous herbs. Combine all six ingredients into a powder, weighing five and a half taels, and form into pills as before. If the illness is not cured, take the third prescription.

Third Prescription
Add four taels of poria and half a tael or one tael of black aconite, prepared without the peel and navel, to the previous ingredients. All eight ingredients combined should weigh ten taels, then make into pills as previously described, increasing the number to thirty pills. This is effective for frequent small intestine gas or chronic cold hernias as large as a gourd, effectively resolving the issue.

  • Chuanlianzi (Melia Fruit) - seedless
  • Malin flower - 1.5 taels each
  • Muxiang (Aromatica) - 0.5 taels, not fire treated
  • Dajie (Euphorbia) - soaked in wine for three days, sliced and dried - 3.5 qian

Grind these into a fine powder. Separately, take Nansha (Real Ferula), Anxixiang (Benzoin), and three ingredients, each 3.5 qian, use one cup of wine and one cup of vinegar to wash away sand and soil, then combine with wine and vinegar to thicken into a paste. Add 1 qian of Musk and 2.5 qian of Myrrh, grind separately, mix into the previous medicine, and form into pills the size of mung beans. Take ten to fifteen pills empty stomach with ash from cotton adjusted in wine.[215p]

　　念珠丸 【《本事方》】 　治膀胱疝气，外肾肿，痛不可忍。　　乳香　硇砂飞，各三钱　黄蜡一两
　　右二味同研匀，熔蜡和丸，分作一百八丸，以线穿之，露一宿，次日，用蛤粉为衣旋用乳香汤下。
　　蜘蛛散　治狐疝。
　　蜘蛛十四枚，炒焦　肉桂半钱，要入厥阴，取肉厚者　　右为散，每服一钱，蜜丸亦可。雷公云：凡使蜘蛛，勿用五色者，兼大身上有刺毛者，并薄小者，须用屋西南有网，身小尻大，腹内有苍黄脓者，真也。凡用，去头足了，研如膏，投药中。此余之法。若炒焦用，则全无功矣。　　又方　治水(疒颓)偏大，上下不定，疼痛不止。　　牡蛎不拘多少，盐泥固济，炭三斤煅，令火尽冷，取二两　干姜一两，焙　　右为细末，二味和匀，冷水调得所，涂病处，小便大利即愈。[216p]

Nianzhu Wan [from "Benshi Fang"]
Cures bladder hernia, external kidney swelling, with unbearable pain.
Ingredients: 3 qian each of frankincense and realgar; 1 liang of yellow wax.
Grind the first two ingredients together, melt the wax, mix into pills, and divide into 108 pills. Thread with string and let them dry overnight. The next day, take with clam powder as a coating, using frankincense decoction for ingestion.

Spider Powder
Cures fox hernia.
Ingredients: 14 pieces of spider, fried until charred; 0.5 qian of cinnamon, from a thicker cut.
Grind the above into powder. Take 1 qian each time; honey pill is also acceptable. Lei Gong says: For all uses of spiders, do not use those with five colors, or those with spiny hairs, or with a thin and small body. Look for those with webs in the southwest of the house, small body and large abdomen, with a yellow pus inside, as they are genuine. For use, remove the head and legs, grind into a paste, and mix with the medicine. If charred, it will have no effect.

Another formula for treating water swelling (group so).
If it is uneven above and below, and the pain does not stop:
Use oysters in any quantity, mixed with salty mud, burn 3 jin of charcoal until the fire goes out and cool, then take 2 liang of it along with 1 liang of dried ginger, roast.
Grind both into fine powder, mix well, and adjust with cold water. Apply to the affected area; if urination is plentiful, you will recover.[216p]

　　橘核丸 【《济生》方】 　治四种(疒颓)病，卵核肿胀，偏有大小，或坚硬如石，痛引脐腹，甚则肤囊肿胀成疮，时出黄水，或成痈溃烂。　　橘核炒　海藻　昆布　海带各洗　川楝肉炒　桃仁麸炒，各一两　制厚朴　木通　枳实麸炒　延胡索炒　桂心　木香各半两　　右为细末，酒糊丸如梧子大，每服七十丸，空心盐酒汤下。虚寒甚者加炮川乌一两；坚胀久不消者加硇砂二钱酢煮，旋入。[217p]

Tangerine Seed Pill [From "Jisheng" Prescriptions]

It treats four types of diseases (fevers): swelling of egg-sized lumps, sometimes varying in size, or as hard as stone, causing pain that radiates to the navel and abdomen. In severe cases, it can lead to skin abscesses that swell and ulcerate, occasionally discharging yellow fluid, or developing into rotten boils.

Ingredients:

  • Fried tangerine seeds
  • Seaweed
  • Kombu
  • Kelp, each washed, 1 ounce
  • Fried chinaberry meat
  • Fried peach kernels, each 1 ounce
  • Processed thick bark
  • Akebia vine
  • Fried bitter orange, each 0.5 ounces
  • Fried Corydalis tuber
  • Cassia bark
  • Wood aromatic, each 0.5 ounces

Grind the above into a fine powder and form into pills the size of a walnut. Take 70 pills each time with a mixture of salt, wine, and broth on an empty stomach. For those with severe cold and deficiency, add 1 ounce of fried black aconite; for persistent and hardened swellings that do not dissipate, add 2 qian of realgar boiled in vinegar, and mix in.[217p]

　　昆布丸　治阴疝肿大偏坠。
　　昆布　海藻各洗去咸，炙　芜荑仁炒　蒺藜子炒，去角　槟榔銼，各一两半　枳壳麸炒火麻仁研，各二两　诃藜勒炒去核　黄芪　木香各七钱五分　陈皮去白炒　桃仁去皮尖，炒研　菟丝子酒浸一宿，另研，各一两　　右为细末研匀，炼蜜和丸如梧桐子大，每服三十九，空心用温酒或盐汤送下。
　　雄黄洗方　治阴疝肿痛不能忍，及阴肿大如斗核痛者。　　雄黄研　甘草各一两　白矾研，二两　　右为细末，每用药一两，热汤五升，通手洗肿处，良久，再暖洗至冷，候汗出瘥。[218p]

Kunbu Pill: Treats yin hernia, swelling, and heaviness.
Kunbu (kombu seaweed), rinse to remove salt, roast; Wuyi seed (a type of wild plant) and prickly ash seeds, both roasted; remove the husks of betel nut shavings, each one and a half liang; Zhiqiao (bitter orange) and hemp seeds, both roasted and ground, two liang each; Heile (coptis) fried and pitted; Huangqi (astragalus) and Muxiang (sandalwood) each seven qian five fen; Chenpi (dried tangerine peel) with white removed and roasted; Peach seed, pitted and roasted and ground; Dodder seeds soaked in wine overnight, ground separately, all one liang each. Mix into a fine powder, refine with honey into pills the size of phoenix seeds. Take thirty-nine each time, on an empty stomach, with warm wine or salt soup.

Xionghuang Wash: Treats unbearable pain from yin hernia swelling, and cases where the swelling is as large as a dou kernel.
Xionghuang (realgar) ground, licorice each one liang; white alum ground, two liang. Mix into a fine powder; for each use, one liang of medicine, five sheng of hot water. Wash the swollen area with the mixture for a long time, then warm wash until cold, waiting for sweat to emerge and for healing.[218p]

　　香附散　治(疒颓)疝胀及小肠气。　　香附不拘多少
　　右为末，每用酒一盏，入海藻一钱，煎至半盏。先捞海藻细嚼，用煎酒调香附末二钱，服。一方以海藻为末，用热酒调尤妙。甚者灌之。一方热酒下荆芥末。
　　海藻丸　治偏坠小肠气效。
　　螌蝥去足翅　巴豆各二十八个，去壳完全者　海藻　海带各一两　　右螌蝥、巴豆二味，同装生绢袋中，用好酢一碗，以瓦铫盛四味同煮，将干，去螌蝥、巴豆不用，只将海带二味，细研为末，以淡豆豉一百粒以煮药，余酢略浸，蒸饼为膏，和药末为丸如梧子大，每服用麝香少许，朱砂三钱，乳钵细研，至无声，却入麝香研匀为衣，日干，以新瓦瓶收之。每初服七粒，再服十粒，三服十五粒。若未愈再进三两服，尽用十五粒，仍用盐炒茴香细嚼，酒吞下，空心服。忌鸭子并鲊酱动气等物。久病，三五服效。此药贵新合效速。若合下稍久，多服为佳。[219p]

Xiangfu San treats swollen hernias and small intestine gas. The amount of Xiangfu is not restricted. First, prepare it as a powder. Each time, use a cup of wine and one qian of kelp, boiled down to half a cup. First, take the kelp and chew it finely, then mix it with two qian of Xiangfu powder using the boiled wine. Another method uses kelp ground into powder mixed with hot wine, which is especially effective. In severe cases, it can be taken as an infusion. Another method uses hot wine to take Jingjie powder.

Hai Zao Wan treats small intestine gas effectively.

For the potion, take twenty-eight pieces each of Dung Beetle and Croton, removing the shells entirely; one liang each of kelp and kombu. Take the Dung Beetle and Croton, put them in a silk bag, use a bowl of good vinegar to boil the four ingredients in a clay pot until dry, then discard the Dung Beetle and Croton. Grind the two types of seaweed into powder, boil with one hundred grains of plain fermented soybeans, lightly soak in the remaining vinegar, then steam into a paste. Mix this with the powdered medicine to form pills the size of a walnut. Each time, take a small amount of musk and three qian of cinnabar, grind finely in a mortar until silent, then mix in the musk to coat the pills, and let them dry in the sun. Store them in a new clay bottle.

Initially, take seven pills, then ten pills, and on the third dose, take fifteen pills. If not cured, take three more doses, using a total of fifteen pills, and continue with salt-fried fennel seeds chewed and swallowed with wine on an empty stomach. Avoid duck and spicy fermented sauces that can cause gas. For chronic illnesses, three to five doses will be effective. This medicine is valuable, fresh, and acts quickly. If taken longer, it is better to increase the dosage.[219p]

(Nodular Hernia) Hernia Formula [from "Thousand Gold Prescriptions"]

  • 50 pieces each of peach kernel and spider
  • 2 taels each of cinnamon heart, tribulus seed, water plantain, earth nut, fangfeng (siler root), five-flavored fruit, tangerine peel, and poria
  • 1 tael each of peony bark, asarum (wild ginger), and seaweed
  • One complete fox genitals

Grind these sixteen ingredients into a fine powder, mix with honey, and form into pills the size of a wutou (a type of nut). Initially take 10 pills, gradually increasing to 30 pills. For the nodular area, apply one pill to the two corners of the claws and half a pill to the tips of the claws. Perform moxibustion on the points seven times. Cure.

[In the segment regarding moxibustion, from "Thousand Gold," it is recorded that for the condition of sudden swelling in the lower regions, align both feet together with the big toes touching, allowing the claws to meet. Use moxibustion at the tip of the two big toes, applying one pill to the corners and half a pill to the tips of the claws. Seven applications yield a cure.][220p]

　　两解汤 【《医学入门》】 　治便毒内蕴热气，外挟寒邪，精气交错，肿结疼痛。　　辣桂　大黄　白芍药　泽泻　牵牛　桃仁各一钱　干姜五分　甘草二分半　　右水煎温服。

　　狼毒丸 【《济生方》，下同】 　治七疝久而不愈，发作无时，脐腹坚硬疼痛。　　狼毒銼炒　芫花酢炒　川乌炮，去皮尖，各一两　椒红炒　干姜炮　干漆炒烟尽　鳖甲酢煮　三棱　没药各半两　全蝎去毒，九枚　　右为细末，酢糊为丸，如梧桐子大，每服四十丸，空心，姜汤温酒任下。
　　益智仁汤　治疝痛连小腹挛搐，叫呼不已，诊其脉沉紧，是肾经有积冷所致。　　益智仁　干姜炮　甘草炙　茴香炒，各三钱　乌头炮去皮　生姜各半两　青皮去白，二钱　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，水二盏，入盐少许，煎至七分，去滓，空心食前温服。[221p]

Liangjie Decoction 【"Introduction to Medicine"】
Treats internal heat and toxins causing pain and swelling, compounded by external cold evils, with intermingled essence and qi.
Ingredients: Spicy Cinnamon, Rhubarb, White Peony root, Alisma, Qian Niu, Peach kernel each 1 qian; Dried Ginger 5 fen; Licorice 2.5 fen.
Boil in water and take warm.

Wolf Poison Pill 【"Jisheng Fang," same below】
Treats chronic hernias that do not heal, with irregular attacks and hard, painful navel and abdomen.
Ingredients: Wolf poison roasted, Yanhua vinegar roasted, Chuanwu prepared (with skin and tip removed) each 1 liang; Red pepper roasted, Dried ginger prepared, Dry lacquer roasted until smoke dissipates, Softshell turtle shell stewed in vinegar, Sanling, Myrrh each 0.5 liang; Whole scorpion, detoxified, 9 pieces.
Grind to a fine powder, mix with vinegar to form pills the size of a paulownia seed; take 40 pills on an empty stomach with warm ginger soup or warm wine.

Yizhi Ren Decoction
Treats hernia pain with cramping in the lower abdomen, accompanied by constant calling for relief, with deep and tight pulse, indicating accumulation of cold in the kidney meridian.
Ingredients: Yizhi Ren, Dried ginger prepared, Roasted Licorice, Stir-fried fennel each 3 qian; Aconite prepared with skin removed and fresh ginger each 0.5 liang; Qingskin removed, 2 qian.
Crush (for oral use) and take 4 qian, with 2 cups of water, add a pinch of salt, boil until reduced to 7 portions, filter dregs, take warm on an empty stomach before meals.[221p]

　　延附汤　治七疝，心腹冷痛，肠鸣气走，身寒自汗，大腑泄泻。　　延胡索炒去皮　附子炮去皮脐，各一两　木香不见火，半两　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，水一盏半，生姜七片，煎至七分，去滓温服，不拘时。　　又方　治偏坠疝气，不拘远年近日。　　木香三钱　破故纸一两　大茴香　川楝二两　小茴香各五钱　青盐一钱五分　　右为末，每服一钱，温酒调下。

Yanfu Decoction: Treats seven types of hernias, cold pain in the heart and abdomen, bowel sounds, gas movement, body cold with spontaneous sweating, and large intestine diarrhea.

  • Stir-fried Rhizoma Corydalis without skin: 1 tael
  • Processed Aconite without skin and navel: 1 tael
  • Wood fragrance (not exposed to fire): 0.5 tael
  • Preparation: Grind the above ingredients to powder. For each dose, take 4 qian, mix with 1.5 mugs of water and 7 slices of fresh ginger, simmer until reduced to 70%, strain and take warm, irrespective of time.

Another Recipe: Treats hernia with a tendency to fall, regardless of duration.

  • Wood fragrance: 3 qian
  • Broken old paper: 1 tael
  • Star anise: 2 taels
  • Chinese olive: 2 taels
  • Fennel: 0.5 tael
  • Green salt: 1.5 qian
  • Preparation: Grind to powder; for each dose, take 1 qian and mix it with warm wine.

Hui Chun Pill: Treats small intestine hernia.

　　大建中汤 【《济生方》，下同】 　治蛊病，小腹急痛，便溺失精，溲而出白液。　　黄芪　远志去心　当归　泽泻各三两　芍药　人参　龙骨　甘草炙，各二两　　右为末，每服三钱，水一盏，生姜五片，煎至八分，去滓温服，不计时候。
