Da Jian Zhong Decoction: Used to treat gu diseases, sudden sharp pain in the lower abdomen, difficulty urinating, loss of essence, and white liquid during urination. Ingredients: Huangqi (3两), Yuan Zhi (去心, 3两), Danggui (3两), Zexie (3两), Shaoyao (2两), Renshen (2两), Longgu (2两), Gancao (2两, roasted). Pulverize the above, take 3 qian each time, boil with one cup of water and five slices of fresh ginger until reduced to 80%, strain, and take warm, regardless of time.

Muyang Powder: Treats heart hernia, persistent pain in the lower abdomen, and chest tightness. Ingredients: Mu Xiang (1两), Chen Pi (1两), Liang Jiang (0.5两), Gan Jiang (0.5两), He Zi Pi (0.5两), Chi Shao (0.5两), Zhi Shi (0.5两, fried). Include Cao Dou Kou (3两), Chuan Xiong (3两), and Hei Qian Niu (3两). Pulverize the above, take 2 qian each time, boil with one cup of water until reduced to 70%, strain, and take warm.

Liuhe Powder: Also known as the Golden Key Powder. Treats small intestine qi stagnation, fullness in the heart and abdomen, chest lumps, and pain radiating. Ingredients: Dahuang (1两, wrapped in paper and roasted), Bai Qian Niu (raw, 0.5两), Hei Qian Niu (slightly fried, 0.5两), Gansui (0.5两), Binglang (3 qian, raw), Qing Fen (1 qian). Grind to a fine powder, take 1 qian each time, mix with honey water, and adjust dosage according to need.

Xiang Ke Powder: Treats small intestine qi, sudden twisting pain in the navel and abdomen, deep pain in the groin, and loss of consciousness. Ingredients: Salt-fried fennel (1两), Zhi Ke (1两), Myrrh (0.5两). Pulverize the above, take 1 qian each time, wash down with warm liquor, irrespective of timing, can be taken two or three times.[223p]

　　疝痛方 【《平治会萃》，下同】 　治食积与瘀血成痛者。　　栀子　桃仁　山楂　枳实　吴茱萸

Hernia Pain Formula

For treating pain caused by food accumulation and blood stasis:
Ingredients: Gardenia fruit, peach kernels, hawthorn, bitter orange, and evodia.
Prepare into a powder, and mix with ginger juice to make a decoction for consumption.

Pain Relief Formula

For hernia; if pressing does not cause pain, use cinnamon twig, as there is deficiency:
Ingredients: Cinnamon twig, fried gardenia, finely chopped and fried aconite.
Prepare into a powder and form into pills with ginger juice; take thirty pills each time.

Another recipe for quick pain relief:
Ingredients: Fried gardenia, fried sugar balls, fried evodia, all in equal parts, and fifteen pieces of bitter orange.
This can be taken either as a decoction or as pills. For those with excessive dampness, add roasted lychee seeds.

Sustained Effect Pills

For treating severe pain; if painless, use this formula:
Ingredients: Atractylodes, southern star, white angelica, hawthorn, chuanxiong, pinellia, one bitter orange and one bitter orange seed.
Prepare into a powder and make pills using fermented dough.

Another recipe for treating a damp-heat condition reaching the large intestine, causing chills and fever, with knotted pain at the small intestine junction:
Ingredients: Fried gardenia, fried bitter orange, fried peach kernels, hawthorn, all in equal parts.
Grind finely, mix with ginger juice, and boil with one cup of water; take hot. For hernia onset, use sea stone and cyperus as powders, preparing with ginger juice. This can also treat heart pain.[224p]

Bian Yong Fang
Ingredients: Five coins each of oyster shell, rhubarb, and licorice, and one Lou fruit soaked in wine overnight. Take this to promote urination.

Heilong Tang
Used to treat swelling and pain in the scrotum, with symptoms of difficulty urinating and alternating chills and fever with thirst.
Ingredients: Equal parts of roasted gentian, bupleurum, mutong, licorice root, honeysuckle, angelica, soapberry, red peony, siler, coptis, and fried wuyuang.
Preparation: Boil in water, taking one dose to relieve swelling and pain. Following this, add chuanxiong and poria.

Loulugang Tang
Used to treat all kinds of abscesses, including syphilis and ulcers.
Ingredients: One tael each of luo lu, white vine, qin with black heart removed, ma huang with nodes removed, sheng ma, peony, stir-fried bitter orange peel without pulp, roasted licorice, and xia, plus two taels of rhubarb.
Preparation: Except for the xia, the rest should be finely minced and mixed evenly with xia. Each dose is three coins, or five coins for a severe case, boiled in one and a half cups of water over medium-high heat until it boils seven times; then strain and take on an empty stomach while hot.[225p]

　　麝香一字　沉香　藿香　木香　丁香俱另研　连翘　射干　独活　升麻　甘草炙　寄生草各一两　大黄一两五钱　　右七味，(口父)咀，与前五味和匀，每服五钱，水一盏半，煎至一盏，去滓温服，取利为度，未利，再服如前。

　　白附子　白芍药　白茯苓　零陵香　白芨　白蔹　白芷　白檀香　藿香　升麻　细辛　黄芪　甘草　杏仁去皮尖，各五钱　脑子一分　(艹舌)蒌根一两　大(艹舌)蒌去皮二两　黄蜡六两　芝麻油一斤　　右先药十四味銼，油内浸百日，于腊月木炭火上银石器内煎至白芷微黄色，离火，入(艹舌)蒌二味着内，煮百沸，重绵滤去滓，再慢火上炼，油香下净黄蜡镕开为度，倾在磁器内收贮，上掺脑子密封，旋用摩风膏贴之。[226p]

Wuxiang Lianqiao Decoction treats the preceding symptoms.
Ingredients: One "character" of musk, one of each: borneol, patchouli, medicinal wood, and clove, ground separately; one tael each of Lianqiao (Forsythia), Shegan (Belamcanda), Duhuo, Shengma, and roasted licorice; two taels and five qian of Dahuang (rhubarb). Mix these seven ingredients with the previous five and take five qian per dose, using one and a half cups of water, boil down to one cup, strain and take warm. If it is not effective, take again as before.

Mofeng Ointment treats the preceding symptoms.
Ingredients: Five qian each of Baifuzhong, Baishao (white peony), Baizhu (Atractylodes), Linglingxiang (alpinia), Baiqi (white qie), Bailan (white rag), Baizhi (white angelica), white sandalwood, patchouli, Shengma, Xixin (Chinese wild ginger), Huangqi (astragalus), licorice, and peeled apricot kernels; one fen of brain matter; one tael of Luogen (Trichosanthes) root; two taels of peeled Luogen; six taels of yellow wax; one jin of sesame oil.
Grind the fourteen medicinal ingredients first, soak in the oil for a hundred days. In the twelfth month, over a charcoal fire in a silver vessel, boil until Baizhi turns a faint yellow, then remove from fire. Add the two Luogen ingredients, bring to a rolling boil, filter out residue, and then gently refine over low heat until the oil is fragrant and clear. Melt the yellow wax until fully dissolved, pour into a ceramic container for storage. Add the brain matter, seal tightly, and apply the Mofeng Ointment as needed.[226p]

Substitute Moxibustion Navel Ointment
Ingredients: Aconite, Ma Linzi, She Chuangzi, Mu Xiang, Rou Gui, Wu Zhu Yu. These six herbs should be ground into a fine powder. Mix one spoonful of the powder with one spoonful of flour and ginger juice to form a paste. Spread it on paper, make it about three inches in diameter, and apply it beneath the navel at the points of Guanyuan and Qihai. Leave it on from dawn until dusk; its warming effect can replace moxibustion effectively. It can also be applied for navel pain.

Yan Hu Suo Bitter Lian Decoction (from the "Medical Principles")
Used to treat cold pain under the navel, characterized by cold and great chill.
Ingredients: Rou Gui and Aconite each three fen, Shu Di Huang one qian, Yan Hu Suo and Ku Lian Zi each two fen, Gan Cao (prepared) half qian, Huang Bo one qian. Combine all ingredients into one dose, using four cups of water, and simmer until reduced to one cup. Take it before meals.

Da Ji Pill
Used to treat swelling or pain in the small intestine.
Ingredients: Ground musk, Da Ji (peeled and shredded, then roasted until yellow), Aconite (prepared and peeled), Betel palm, Fennel, He Zi (cooked and pitted), each half liang; Chuan Lian five liang, Hu Lu Ba four liang, Mu Xiang one liang. Grind these into powder, specifically take Chuan Lian, using two jin of good wine and seven pieces of scallions (each three to four inches long), boil the Chuan Lian until soft, remove the skin and pit to get the flesh, mix with the powdered herbs, and form into pills the size of apricot kernels. Take ten pills with warm empty wine. For pain accompanied by tidal symptoms, take fifteen pills with ginger in hot wine.[230p]

The Complete Deer Pill nourishes Yang, replenishes deficiencies, and its benefits cannot be fully described. If a person takes one dose, it can extend life by a decade. The preparation must be shared by four people who each consume a portion of one deer. After a year, they prepare it again together, and after four years, each person will have one complete deer. If one person prepares a dose alone, it risks spoiling over time and losing its medicinal potency.

To make it, take a deer, kill it, remove the hair, wash out the internal organs, and cook the deer meat with wine until done. Cut the meat into strips and dry it to a powder. Take the skin, mix it, and boil it with the original broth to form a paste. Combine this paste with the meat powder and honey to form pills. Its bones should be roasted and powdered, then mixed with ginseng, white atractylodes, poria, honey-fried licorice, angelica, ligusticum, raw and cooked rehmannia, honey-fried astragalus, asparagus, wheat, goji berries, eucommia treated with salty water, prepared ox knee with wine, yam, water chestnut, dodder seed, morinda, schisandra, cistanche mixed with wine, prepared lotus root with wine, and raspberry treated with wine, along with autumn stones, ligusticum, and dried tangerine peel, each one tael.

First, the medicinal ingredients must be finely powdered and mixed thoroughly. Once the deer glue is ready, combine it with the mixture to form pills the size of apricot seeds, then dry them. Use raw yellow silk to make fifty small bags, each capable of holding about one pound, and hang them in a well-ventilated place. After consuming one bag, take another. On damp days, it is advisable to warm them over a fire a couple of times. Each dose is eight to ninety pills, taken on an empty stomach before bedtime, washed down with ginger soup, salt soup, clear soup, or warm wine in winter is also acceptable.[234p]

  • 5 qian each of green salt and ginseng.

Grind the above into a fine powder, refine with honey into pills the size of a walnut, taking 60 to 70 pills each time, washed down with warm wine on an empty stomach. It is also beneficial for other hernias that do not occur frequently.[241p]

　　滋阴八物汤　治悬痈初起，状如莲子，红赤渐肿，悠悠作痛者。　　川芎　当归　赤芍　生地　牡丹皮　天花粉　甘草节各一钱　泽泻五分　水二锺，灯心二十根，煎八分，食前服。便秘加蜜大黄一钱。
　　还元保真汤　治悬痈已溃，疮口开张，脓水淋漓，不能收敛者。　　当归　川芎　白芍　熟地黄　白朮　白茯苓　人参　黄芪各一钱　牡丹皮　枸杞子各八分　甘草炙　熟附子各五分肉桂　泽泻各二分　水二锺，煨姜三片，大枣二枚，煎八分，食前服。
　　滋阴九宝饮　治悬痈厚味膏粱，蕴热结肿，小水濇滞，大便秘结，内热口干，烦渴饮冷，及六脉沉实有力者，服。　　川芎　当归　白芍　生地　黄连　天花粉　知母　黄蘗　大黄蜜水拌炒，各二钱　水二锺，煎八分，空心服。[242p]

Zi Yin Ba Wu Decoction: For treating early-stage abscesses that appear like lotus seeds, gradually swelling, and causing dull pain. Ingredients: Chuanxiong, Danggui, Chishaoshu, Shengdi, Mudanpi, Tianhuafen, and Licorice each 1 qian, Zexie 5 fen, 2 zhongs of water, 20 strands of lamp wick, decoct to 8 parts, take before meals. For constipation, add 1 qian of honey and Dahuang.

Huan Yuan Bao Zhen Decoction: For treating abscesses that have already ruptured, with an open wound, oozing pus and cannot be contained. Ingredients: Danggui, Chuanxiong, Baishao, Shudi, Baizhu, Baifuling, Ren Shen, Huangqi each 1 qian, Mudanpi, and Gouqizi each 8 fen, roasted Licorice and cooked Fuzi each 5 fen, Rougui and Zexie each 2 fen, 2 zhongs of water, add 3 slices of ginger, 2 jujubes, decoct to 8 parts, take before meals.

Zi Yin Jiu Bao Drink: For treating abscesses caused by rich food that lead to heat accumulation and swelling, with stunted urination, constipation, internal heat, dry mouth, thirst, and a strong pulse. Ingredients: Chuanxiong, Danggui, Baishao, Shengdi, Huanglian, Tianhuafen, Zhi Mu, Huangbo, Dahuang mixed with honey, each 2 qian, 2 zhongs of water, decoct to 8 parts, take on an empty stomach.[242p]

　　左归丸 【《景岳全书》，下同】 　治真阴肾水不足，不能滋养营卫，渐至衰弱，宜壮水之主以培左肾之元阴，而精血自充矣，宜此方主之。　　大熟地八两　山药炒　枸杞子　山茱萸肉　鹿角胶敲碎炒珠　龟板胶切碎炒珠，无火者不用　菟丝子各四两　川牛膝酒洗，蒸，三两，精滑者不用　　右先将熟地蒸烂杵膏，加炼蜜丸桐子大，每食前，用滚汤或淡盐汤送下百余丸。
　　右归丸　治元阳不足，或先天禀衰，或劳伤过度，以致命门火衰，宜益火之原以培右肾之元阳，而神气自强矣，此方主之。　　大熟地八两　山萸微炒，三两　当归三两，便溏勿用　鹿角胶炒珠　枸杞微炒　山药炒　菟丝子制　杜仲姜汁炒，各四两　肉桂二两，渐可加至四两　制附子自二两，渐可加至五六两　　右丸法如前，或丸如弹子大，每嚼服二三丸，以滚白汤送下，其效尤速。[243p]

Zuo Gui Wan (Left Return Pill)
Treats insufficient true yin and kidney water, which fails to nourish the nutritive and defensive qi, leading to gradual weakness. It is advised to strengthen the water essence to cultivate the original yin of the left kidney, allowing essence and blood to replenish naturally. This formula is specific for that purpose.

  • 8 taels prepared rehmannia
  • 4 taels sautéed Chinese yam
  • 4 taels goji berries
  • 4 taels flesh of cornelian cherry
  • 4 taels crushed and sautéed deer antler gelatin
  • 4 taels chopped and sautéed turtle shell gelatin (omit if without fire)
  • 4 taels dodder seed
  • 3 taels steamed and wine-washed Chinese angelica
    (Use only the smooth parts)
    First, steam the prepared rehmannia until soft, pound into a paste, add refined honey, and form into large pills the size of a tung nut. Take a hundred or more pills before meals, sending them down with hot soup or lightly salted soup.

You Gui Wan (Right Return Pill)
Treats insufficient original yang, either from innate deficiency or excessive fatigue, leading to diminished fire at the life gate. It is advised to enhance the original fire to cultivate the original yang of the right kidney, thereby strengthening the spirit and vitality. This formula is specific for that purpose.

  • 8 taels prepared rehmannia
  • 3 taels lightly sautéed cornelian cherry
  • 3 taels Angelica sinensis (avoid if loose)
  • 4 taels sautéed deer antler gelatin
  • 4 taels lightly sautéed goji berries
  • 4 taels sautéed Chinese yam
  • 4 taels prepared dodder seed
  • 4 taels sautéed eucommia with ginger juice
  • 2 to 4 taels cinnamon (gradually increase)
  • 2 to 5 or 6 taels prepared aconite (gradually increase)
    The method for making this pill is the same as above, or make pills the size of small balls. Chew two or three pills, sending them down with hot white soup for quicker effects.[243p]

　　七福饮　凡五脏气血亏损者，此能兼治之，足称王道之最。　　人参　熟地各随宜　当归二三钱　枣仁二钱　白朮炒一钱半　炙甘草一钱　远志三五分制　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。或加生姜三五片。凡治气血俱虚等证，以此为主。或宜温者加姜、附，宜散者加升麻、柴、葛。左右逢源，无不可也。
　　大营煎　治真阴精血亏损，及妇人经迟血少，腰膝筋骨疼痛，或气血虚寒，心腹疼痛等证。　　当归二三钱或五钱　熟地三五七钱　枸杞子　杜仲炒去丝，各二钱　炙甘草　肉桂各一二钱　牛膝一钱半　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。
　　补阴益气煎　此补中益气汤之变方也。凡属阴气不足，而虚邪外侵者，用此升散，无不神效。　　人参一二三钱　当归　山药酒炒，各二三钱　熟地三五钱，或一二两　陈皮　炙甘草各一钱　升麻三五分，火浮于上者勿用　柴胡一二钱无外邪者勿用　水二锺，加生姜三五七片，煎八分，食远温服。[244p]

Seven Blessings Decoction: For those with deficiencies in the five organs' energy and blood, this is an effective treatment, rightly considered the pinnacle of the royal way.

  • American ginseng and cooked rehmannia as appropriate
  • Angelica sinensis: 2-3 qian
  • Jujube seeds: 2 qian

If warmth is needed, add ginger or additional herbs; for dispersal, add licorice, chuanxiong, or kudzu. There are no restrictions.

Large营 Decoction: For treating true yin, essence, and blood deficiencies, as well as delayed menstruation and scanty blood in women, pain in the waist and knees, or pain in the heart and abdomen due to Qi and blood deficiency and coldness.

Yin Supplementing and Qi Enhancing Decoction: This is a transformed formula of the Middle Supplementing and Qi Enhancing Decoction. For those with insufficient yin energy and external pathogens invading the body, this will disperse effectively without fail.

　　保阴煎　治男妇带浊遗淋，色赤带血，脉滑多热，便血不止，及血崩血淋，或经期太早，或一切阴虚内热动血等证。　　生地　熟地　芍药各二钱　山药　川续断　黄芩　黄蘗各一钱半　生甘草一钱　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

Drawing Fire Beverage: Treats all cases of excessive heat that are not suitable for tonics. Ingredients: 1-2 qian each of huangqin, dendrobium, mutong, stir-fried gardenia, and huangbo, 1.5 qian each of bitter orange and ze xie, 3 fen of fine licorice, and 1.5 sheng of water. Decoction should be taken warm, far from meals, until 7 parts. For severe internal heat, it is better taken cold.

Transitioning Fire Beverage: Treats the fire of the triple burner; for all cases of internal heat that are noticeable but not severe, it is advisable to first clear with this remedy; for severe cases, the previous recipe should be used. Ingredients: 8 fen of tangerine peel, 2 qian of huangqin, 1.5 qian each of ophiopogon, peony, huangbo, poria, and peony root, and 1.5 sheng of water. Decoction should be taken warm, far from meals, until 7 parts.

Greatly Clearing Beverage: Treats accumulated heat and obstruction, difficulties in urination, or severe pain in the lower back and abdomen; conditions such as damp-heat diarrhea, jaundice with bloody urine, accumulation of evil heat and blood, abdominal pain, and urinary obstruction. Ingredients: 2 qian each of poria, ze xie, and mutong, 1 qian each of pigweed, bitter orange, stir-fried gardenia (or double the amount), and plantago seeds, and 1.5 sheng of water. Decoction should be taken warm, far from meals, until 8 parts.[245p]

　　滋阴八味丸　治阴虚火盛，下焦湿热等证。此方变丸为汤，即名滋阴八味煎。　　山药　山茱萸肉各四两　牡丹皮　白茯苓　泽泻　知母盐水炒　黄蘗盐水炒，各三两　熟地黄八两蒸捣　　右加炼蜜捣丸梧桐子大，或空心、或午前，用滚白汤或淡盐汤送下百余丸。

Zi Yin Ba Wei Wan: Treats symptoms of excess fire from Yin deficiency, lower jiao damp heat, and so forth. This formula can be transformed from pills into a decoction, named Zi Yin Ba Wei Jian.

Ingredients:

Combine the above and add honey to form pills the size of a phoenix seed, taken either hollow or in the morning, to be swallowed with hot white soup or lightly salted soup, over a hundred pills.

　　暖肝煎　治肝肾阴寒，小腹疼痛疝气等证。　　当归二三钱　枸杞三钱　沉香一钱，或木香亦可　茯苓　小茴香　乌药各二钱　肉桂一二钱　水一锺半，加生姜三五片，煎七分，食远温服。如寒甚者加吴茱萸、干姜，再甚者加附子。
　　寿脾煎　一名摄营煎。治脾虚不能摄血等证。凡忧思郁怒积劳，及误用攻伐等药，犯损脾阴，以致中气亏陷，神魂不宁，大便脱血不止，或妇人无火崩淋等证。凡兼呕恶，尤为危候，速宜用此。单救脾气，则统摄固而血自归原。此归脾汤之变方，其效如神。若犯此证，再用寒凉，则胃气必脱，无不即毙者。并治血。　　白朮二三钱　当归　山药各二钱　枣仁钱半　远志三五分　干姜炮一二三钱　炙甘草一钱　莲肉炒，二十粒　人参随宜一二钱，急者用一两　水二锺，煎服。[248p]

Warm Liver Decoction: Treats coldness of liver and kidney yin, pain in the lower abdomen, hernia, and other conditions. Ingredients: 2-3 qian of Angelica, 3 qian of Goji berries, 1 qian of agarwood (or wood incense can also be used), 2 qian each of Poria, fennel, and cyperus, 1-2 qian of cinnamon, and 1.5 sheng of water. Longevity Spleen Decoction, also known as Nourishing Qi Decoction: Treats spleen deficiency unable to hold blood and other related conditions. Symptoms include worry, anger, accumulated labor, and misuse of harsh herbs, harming the yin of the spleen, leading to deficiency of middle qi, unsettled spirit, loss of blood in stool, or women's conditions like constant bleeding. If accompanied by nausea, it becomes critical, and this should be used urgently. By supporting spleen qi, it stabilizes, allowing blood to return to normal. This is a variation of the Gui Pi Tang with significant efficacy. If such symptoms occur again and coldness is applied, the gastric qi will surely collapse, leading to immediate danger. It also treats blood issues. Ingredients: 2-3 qian of Atractylodes, 2 qian each of Angelica and Chinese yam, 1.5 qian of jujube seed, 3-5 fen of magnolia, 1-2-3 qian of roasted ginger, 1 qian of honey-fried licorice, 20 fried lotus seeds, and 1-2 qian of ginseng as needed (for urgent cases, use up to 1 liang). Mi Yuan Decoction: Treats seminal emission with turbidity among other ailments, specifically targeting the heart and spleen. Ingredients include: eight parts of roasted Yuanzhi, roasted Shan Yao, roasted Qian Shi, pitted Jin Ying Zi, and roasted Zao Ren, each two qian; half a qian each of roasted Bai Zhu and Fu Ling; one qian of roasted Gan Cao; one to two qian of Ren Shen; fourteen Wu Wei Zi (avoid if sensitive to sourness). Use two sheng of water, decoct to seven parts, and consume warm after meals. This is used for chronic seminal emission without heat, occurring without pain but with slipperiness. If there is still heat felt, add one to two qian of Ku Shen. If there is great Qi deficiency, add one to three qian of Huang Qi.

Gu Yin Decoction: Treats Yin deficiency with diarrhea, turbidity and dripping, and menstrual issues due to lack of stability, specifically targeting the liver and kidneys. Ingredients include: appropriate amount of Ren Shen; three to five qian of cooked Di Huang; two qian of roasted Shan Yao; one and a half qian of Shan Zhu Yu; seven parts of roasted Yuanzhi; one to two qian of roasted Gan Cao; fourteen Wu Wei Zi; two to three qian of fragrant roasted Tu Si Zi. Use two sheng of water, decoct to seven parts, and consume warm after meals.

Qing Hua Drink: Treats blood heat causing unrestrained movements, as well as various conditions due to Yin deficiency and unclear heat. Ingredients include: two qian each of Shao Yao and Mai Dong; two to three qian each of Dan Pi, Fu Ling, and Huang Qin; one qian of Sheng Di; one and a half sheng of water, decoct to seven parts, and consume warm after meals.[249p]

　　赞育丹　治阳痿精衰，虚寒无子等证妙方。　　熟地蒸捣　白朮各八两　当归　枸杞各六两　杜仲酒炒　仙茅酒蒸一日　巴戟肉甘草汤炒　山茱萸　淫羊藿羊脂拌炒　肉苁蓉酒洗去甲　韭子炒黄，各四两　附子制　蛇床子微炒　肉桂各二两　　右加炼蜜丸服，或加人参、鹿茸亦妙。
　　荔香散　治疝气痛极。凡在气分者，最宜用之。并治小腹气痛等证，神效。　　荔枝核炮微焦　大茴香等分，炒
　　右为末，用好酒调服二三钱。如寒甚者，加制过吴茱萸减半用之。
　　芍药蒺藜煎　治通身湿热疮疹，及下部红肿热痛诸疮，神效。外以螵蛸粉敷之。　　龙胆草　栀子　黄芩　木通　泽泻各钱半　芍药　生地各二钱　白蒺藜连刺槌碎，五钱，甚者一两　水二锺，煎八分，食远服。如火不甚者，宜去龙胆、栀子，加当归、茯苓、薏苡仁之属。如湿毒甚者，加土茯苓五钱或一二两。[250p]

Zan Yu Dan: A marvelous formula for treating symptoms of impotence and weakness, as well as conditions of cold and infertility.

Ingredients:

  • 8 taels of cooked Rehmannia, steamed and mashed
  • 8 taels of Atractylodes
  • 6 taels each of Dang Gui and Goji berries
  • 6 taels of Eucommia, stir-fried in wine
  • 1 day's steam of Xian Mao in wine
  • 6 taels of Ba Jiu meat, stir-fried in Glycyrrhiza soup
  • 4 taels each of Cornus and Epimedium, stir-fried with sheep's fat
  • 4 taels of Cistanche, washed in wine to remove the shell
  • 4 taels of chives, stir-fried until yellow
  • 2 taels each of Aconite and Cnidium, lightly stir-fried
  • 2 taels of Cinnamon

Take the above ingredients mixed with refined honey into pill form for consumption. Ginseng or deer antlers may be added for added effect.

Li Xiang San: A remedy for severe pain from hernias. Particularly effective for conditions affecting the qi, as well as for lower abdominal pain among other symptoms, showing remarkable efficacy.

Ingredients:

  • Slightly charred lychee seeds
  • Equal parts of star anise, stir-fried

Grind the above into a fine powder and mix with good wine to consume 2 to 3 qian. If cold is severe, add half the amount of processed Wu Zhu Yu.

Shao Yao Zhi Li Jian: A treatment for body-wide damp-heat sores and lower body red, swollen, painful sores, demonstrating miraculous effects. Externally apply dried cuttlefish powder as a poultice.

Ingredients:

  • 0.5 qian each of Gentian, Gardenia, Scutellaria, Clematis, and Alisma
  • 2 qian each of Peony and raw Rehmannia
  • 5 qian of white Tribulus, crushed together with spines (1 tael for more severe cases)

Boil in 2 bowls of water until reduced to 8 parts and consume away from food. If fire is not severe, remove Gentian and Gardenia, adding Dang Gui, Poria, and Job's tears instead. If damp toxin is severe, add 5 qian to 1 or 2 taels of earth Poria.[250p]

　　百草煎　治百般痈毒，诸疮损伤，疼痛腐肉，肿胀，或风寒湿气，留聚走注疼痛等证，无不奇效。　　田野山间百草，无论诸品，皆可取用。然犹以山草为胜，辛香者佳。冬月可用干者，须预为收采之。　　右不论多寡，取以多煎浓汤，乘热熏洗患处，仍用布帛蘸之。良久，务令药气蒸透，然后敷贴他药，每日二三次不拘，但以频数为善。盖其性之寒者可以除热，热者可以散寒，香者可以行气，毒者可以解毒。无所不用，亦无所不利。汤得药性则汤气无害，药得汤气则药力愈行。凡用百草以煎膏者，其义亦此。此诚外科中最要最佳之法，亦传之于方外人者也。[251p]

Bai Cao Jian (Hundred Herbs Decoction) treats various types of carbuncles and toxins, wounds, painful rotten flesh, swelling, and conditions caused by wind, cold, and dampness. It has remarkable effects on all such ailments.

The herbs gathered from fields and mountains can be used indiscriminately, although mountain herbs are preferred, particularly those that are aromatic and pungent. In winter, dried herbs may be used, but they must be harvested in advance.

Regardless of quantity, prepare a concentrated decoction by boiling it down, and while hot, use it to steam and wash the affected area, applying it with a cloth. After a considerable time, ensure that the medicinal vapor thoroughly penetrates, and then apply other medicines. This should be done two to three times daily as often as possible.

The cooling properties of certain herbs can dispel heat, while warming ones can disperse cold. Aromatic herbs can promote the flow of qi, and detoxifying ones can eliminate toxins. Every herb has its use and benefit. When the decoction captures the properties of the herbs, its vapor becomes harmless; when the herbs absorb the vapor, their power is enhanced.

The principle of using various herbs to create a decoction follows this reasoning. This method is indeed one of the most essential and effective in surgery, also shared with those outside the medical profession.[251p]

　　螵蛸散　治湿热破烂，毒水淋漓等疮，或下部肾囊，足股肿痛下疳诸疮，无不神效。　　海螵蛸　人中白等分。或人中黄、硇砂皆可　　右为细末，先以百草多煎浓汤，乘热熏洗，后以此药掺。如干者，以麻油或熬猪油或蜜水调敷之。若肿而痛甚者，加冰片少许更妙。若湿疮脓水甚者，加密陀僧等分，或煅过官粉亦可，加煅制炉甘石更佳。
　　银朱烟　治头发生虱及诸疮之有虫者。　　银朱四五分，揩擦厚纸上，点着置一碗中，上用一湿碗，露缝覆之，其烟皆着于湿碗之上　　右用指揩碗上烟，擦发中，覆以毡帽，则虮虱皆尽矣。此烟以枣肉捻作饼，或作丸，或擦于猪鸡熟肝之间，用贴诸疮癣之有虫者。及虫蚀肛门者，以绵裹枣丸纳肛门中一宿，无不神效。须留绵带在外，以便出之。[252p]

Piao Xiao San is used to treat damp-heat necrosis, toxic sores with oozing, or sores in the lower part of the kidney capsule, and for swollen and painful sores in the groin, all of which yield miraculous effects. Hai Piao Xiao is divided into equal parts with "Ren Zhong Bai" (or "Ren Zhong Huang" or "Nai Sha" is also acceptable).

Make a fine powder of the above, first boil a strong decoction of various herbs, then use it hot to steam and wash the affected area, followed by applying this medication. If it is dry, mix with sesame oil, rendered pig fat, or honey water for application. If swollen and very painful, adding a bit of borneol is even better. For wet sores with much pus, adding equal parts of Mi Tuo Sang (or calcined alum powder) is also recommended; mixing with calcined Lu Gan Shi (heavy metal) is even more effective.

Yin Zhu Yan is for treating lice in the hair and other insect-infested sores. Take four or five parts of Yin Zhu, rub it on thick paper, light it, and place it in a bowl covered with a damp bowl above it to capture the smoke on the underside. Use a finger to rub the smoke onto the scalp and cover it with a wool hat, then all lice will be eradicated. This smoke can also be made into cakes with jujube pulp, or formed into pills, or rubbed on between cooked pig or chicken livers for application to insect-infested sores and ringworm. For insects affecting the anal area, a jujube pill wrapped in cotton can be inserted into the anus overnight, and it will certainly be effective. Be sure to leave some cotton hanging outside for easy removal.[252p]

　　完疮散　治湿烂诸疮，肉平不敛，及诸疮毒内肉既平，而有口不收者，皆宜用此最妙。　　滑石飞一两　赤石脂飞五钱　粉甘草三钱　　右为末，干掺，或用麻油调敷，或加枯矾一钱，痒者极宜。若痒甚者必有虫，先用水银三四钱，同松香二钱，研匀后，拌前药和匀敷之。
　　银粉散　治下疳疮，毋论新久，但腐烂作痛，及悞熏杨梅疮后，致结毒，玉茎腐烂，或阳物半伤半全者，并宜用之。　　好锡六钱，化开，入朱砂末二钱，搅炒砂枯，去砂留锡，再化开，投水银一两，和匀，倾出听用　杭粉一两，铺夹纸平地上，卷成一条，一头点火，烧至纸尽为度，吹去灰，用粉　真轻粉一两　　右共成一家研细。凡遇前患，先用甘草汤淋洗挹干，随用此药掺上，止痛生肌收敛，极妙。[253p]

Wanchuang San: Used to treat various moist ulcers that do not close when the flesh is flat and for ulcers where the internal flesh is already flat but has an opening that does not heal. This remedy is highly effective.

Ingredients:

  • 1 ounce Talcum
  • 5 qian Red Resin
  • 3 qian Powdered Licorice

Grind these into a fine powder. Mix with dry powder, or use sesame oil to create a paste, or add 1 qian alum if itching is severe. If itching is extreme, there are likely insects; first use 3 to 4 qian mercury, together with 2 qian pine resin, knead them together, then mix with the previous medicine and apply.

Yinfen San: Used for ulcers of the lower body, regardless of whether they are new or old, as long as they are rotten and painful, including cases of Yangmei scald resulting in toxic hardening, jade stem decay, or partially injured male organs.

Preparation:

  • 6 qian Tin, melted
  • 2 qian Cinnabar powder, mixed in and stirred, then roasted to remove impurities, leaving only tin. Re-melt and add 1 ounce of mercury, mixing well, then strain for use.

1 ounce of Hang powder, spread on a flat piece of paper and rolled into a cylinder. Light one end, burn it until the paper is gone, then blow away the ash. Add 1 ounce True Light Powder to the previous mixture and grind finely.

For all prior conditions, first wash with Licorice decoction to cleanse and dry, then apply this medicine to relieve pain, promote healing, and close wounds—highly effective.[253p]

　　珍珠散　治下疳皮损肉烂，痛极难忍，及诸疮新肉已满，不能生皮；又汤泼火烧，皮损肉烂，疼痛不止者。　　青缸花五分。如无可用头刀靛花体轻虚而色翠者代之，然终不及缸花为妙　珍珠一钱，不论大小，以新白为上，入豆腐内煮数滚，研为极细，无声　真轻粉一两　　右三味，共研千转，如飞面，方入罐收。凡下疳初起皮损，搽之即愈。腐烂疼痛者，甘草汤洗净，猪脊髓调搽。如诸疮不生皮者，用此干掺，即可生皮。又妇人阴蚀疮，或新嫁内伤痛甚者，亦用此搽，极效。汤泼火烧痛甚者，用玉红膏调搽之。
　　山甲内消散　治鱼口便毒、骑马痈、横痃等证，初起未成脓者。　　当归梢　甘草节　大黄各三钱　土木鳖三个　穿山甲炮，三大片　僵蚕　黑牵牛各一钱　　右以酒水各一碗，煎八分，空心服。滓再煎服。大便行三四次，方吃稀粥。淡味饮食为妙。

Pearl Powder: For treating ulcerative skin lesions and severe pain that is difficult to endure, especially when the new flesh has fully grown and cannot produce skin; also for severe burns and ulcerations that result in continuous pain.

Ingredients:

  • Five parts of "Qingganghua" (blue flower). If unavailable, substitute with "Toudao Dianhua" (light and bright indigo flower), although it is not as effective as "Qingganghua".
  • One penny of pearl, regardless of size, with fresh white being the best. Cooked in tofu until rolling, ground into a fine powder, making no noise.
  • One tael of "Zhēnqīngfěn" (true light powder).

Preparation: Grind these three ingredients together thoroughly until as fine as flour, then store in a jar. For newly appearing skin lesions, applying this directly will yield healing. For rotten and painful lesions, wash with licorice soup and apply mixed pig spinal marrow. If ulcers are not healing, using this powder will encourage skin regeneration. Additionally, it is effective for women with vaginal ulcers or new brides with severe internal pain; apply this powder. For severe burns and pain, use "Yuhong ointment" for application.

Shanjia Neixiao Powder: For treating symptoms like fish mouth poison, horseback riding carbuncles, and transverse rheumatism, particularly in the early stages before pus formation.

Ingredients:

  • Three qian of "Danggui Shao" (Angelica stems)
  • Three qian of licorice segments
  • Three qian of rhubarb
  • Three "Tǔmùbiē" (traditional Chinese herb)
  • Three large pieces of "Chuan Shanjia" (pangolin scales)
  • One qian each of "Jiangcan" (silkworm) and "Heiqian Niu" (black morning glory).

Preparation: Boil each ingredient with one bowl of water and wine until down to eight parts, and take on an empty stomach. Re-boil the residue for consumption. After three to four bowel movements, consume thin porridge with a light diet recommended.

Source: Comprehensive Collection of Ancient and Modern Medical Books, Volume 200, Section 5.

Location: Anterior vulva.

Note: This is a singular prescription.[254p]

　　丈夫阴囊湿痒及阴汗：取铸铧鉏孔中黄土细末，扑之。 【藏器】
　　男阴卒肿，及阴冷发闷，冷气入腹，肿满杀人：用釜月下土和鸡子白敷之。 【《千金方》，下同】
　　阴冷疼闷，冷气入腹，肿胀杀人，酢和热灰频熨之。

　　阴汗湿痒：用炉甘石一分，真蚌粉半两，细研粉扑之。 【《直指方》】
　　偏坠气痛：陈石灰炒、五倍子、山栀子等分为末，面和酢调敷之，一夜即可消。 【《医方摘要》】
　　小肠疝气，茎缩囊肿者：用浮石为末，每服二钱，木通、赤茯苓、麦门冬煎汤调下。 【《直指方》】　　又方：海石、香附等分为末，每服二钱，姜汁调下。 【丹溪方】
　　阴湿疮疱：硫黄敷，日三。 【《梅师方》】
　　交接劳复，卵肿或缩入，腹痛欲绝：矾石一分，硝三分，大麦粥调服方寸匕，日三服，热毒从二便出也。【《肘后方》】[255p]

  1. For a man's scrotum being moist and itchy, use fine yellow earth powder taken from the hole of a cast plow to apply.
  2. If the male genitalia suddenly swell and feel cold with a dull sensation leading to abdominal coldness, use earth from under a pot mixed with egg white to apply.
  3. For cold pain and pressure in the genitals leading to abdominal coldness and swelling: mix vinegar with hot ash and apply frequently.
  4. For moisture and sweating in the genitals: use one ounce of talc, half an ounce of gypsum, and a little bit of white alum, ground together.
  5. For moist and itchy sweat in the genitals: use one part realgar powder and half an ounce of real clam powder, finely ground and dusted on.
  6. For localized pain due to gas: fry aged lime, make a powder with galls and mountain gardenia in equal parts, mix with vinegar, and apply; it will dissipate overnight.
  7. For inguinal hernia and retractile testicular cysts: use pumice stone powdered, take two qian with a decoction of mutong, red poria, and mai men dong.
  8. Additionally: mix sea stone and cyperus in equal parts, take two qian with ginger juice.
  9. For humid sores and blisters in the genitals: apply sulfur three times a day.
  10. For labor-induced relapse with testicular swelling or retraction, causing severe abdominal pain: take one part alum and three parts saltpeter, mixed with large barley porridge, taken three times a day; heat infections will expel through urination and defecation.[255p]

　　阴下湿痒：甘草煎汤，日洗三五度。 【《古今录验》】
　　阴汗湿痒：用绵黄芪酒炒为末，以猪心煮熟蘸吃，妙。 【《济急方》】
　　卒得疝气，小腹及阴中相引痛如绞，白汁出欲死者：沙参捣筛为末，酒服方寸匕，立瘥。【《肘后方》】
　　寒疝腹痛，小腹阴中相引痛，自汗出欲死：丹参一两为末，每服二钱，热酒调下。 【《圣惠方》】
　　阴(疒颓)偏肿：白头翁根生者，不限多少，捣敷肿处，一宿当作疮，二十日愈。

  • For itching and dampness in the lower yin area: decoct licorice, wash three to five times a day.
  • For sweating and itching in the yin area: use yellow astragalus, stir-fried and powdered, then dip cooked pig heart in it and eat – it's wonderful.
  • For sudden hernia with sharp pain in the lower abdomen and groin feeling like being strangled, with white discharge: pound sand ginseng to a powder, take a small spoonful with wine and it will heal instantly.
  • For cold hernia abdominal pain with similar pulling pain in the lower abdomen, and sweating leading to a feeling of death: take one tael of salvia miltiorrhiza powdered, and take two qian with hot wine.
  • For swollen and painful yin area: pound the root of white peony, applying it to the swollen area; it will form a sore overnight and heal in twenty days.
  • For swelling and painful bulging in men’s yin: use powdered snake bed seed mixed with egg yolk to apply.

  • For swelling and pain in the hernia and small intestine gas: take two qian of cyperus powder, boil it with one qian of seaweed in wine, take on an empty stomach, and eat the seaweed.[256p]

　　阴(疒颓)肿痛：荆芥穗瓦焙为散，酒服二钱，即消。【《寿域神方》】

　　虾蟆散：治阴蚀欲尽，疮痛甚者。虾蟆一枚烧灰，兔粪一两同研细，每用少许敷疮上，日三四次。

　　寒疝不能食，及腹内一切诸疾，消食肥肌：马蔺子一升，每日取一把，以面拌煮吞之，服尽愈。【《集验方》】
　　胭脂散，治阴疮。坯子胭脂、真菉豆粉各等分，同研匀敷之。[257p]

  • Swelling and pain from the Yin (neurasthenia): Grind the spikes of schizonepeta in a tile, take two coins with wine, and it will dissipate.

  • Simple formula for scrofula sores: Use the ashes from an old satin hat rim soaked in oil, calcine it together with equal parts of yellow haoma powder on a tile, grind very finely, and store in a magnetic jar. First, take fifteen red dates and three coins of licorice, boil them in water to wash the affected area, then dry the area and apply the medicine, and it will be effective.

  • Toad powder: For treating severe pain from ulcerative conditions. Burn one toad to ash, mix with one tael of rabbit droppings and grind finely. Apply a small amount to the sore three to four times daily.

  • Pain in the small intestine: Roast and grind huluba, take two coins with fennel wine.

  • Cold hernia pain: Soak huluba in wine and dry it, roast and grind buckwheat, both four taels, and one tael of fennel to make a powder. Form pills the size of a walnut with wine paste, take fifty pills with warm saline or salted wine. If symptoms persist for two months and the stool passes white pus, it will eliminate the root cause.

  • For sores beneath the genitals: Take 8 taels each of diying (earth herb) and huanglian (coptis), chew the two together, boil in 15 liters of water, extract down to 6 liters, filter, and wash the sores with water of suitable temperature, twice a day. Alternatively, washing with the juice of huanglian alone is also effective.

  • For soft chancre treatment: For mild cases, use only light powder as a medicine to apply.

  • For frog chancre: Mix equal parts light powder and shaofen into a fine powder and apply.

  • For internal and external carious sores: Use 2 parts borneol, 6 parts light powder, and 0.5 parts musk, grind into fine powder, and apply inside the sore.

  • For soft chancre treatment: Use 1 qian each of burnt olive and huer tea, and 0.3 qian borneol to make a fine powder; first use 0.4 qian of almond, remove the skin and tip, grind separately, then mix in another 0.4 qian of light powder to form a paste. Apply to the affected area for one day, then wash with rice wash; afterwards, apply the prior mixed medicine.

  • Another method: Remove the pits from red dates, fill them with 0.2 qian alum and 0.4 qian pearl, calcine them, and grind into fine powder to apply dry.

  • Another remedy: For unbearable pain, use 2 qian of black ram’s horn, and pangolin scales, ground finely after calcination, and add 1 qian each of frankincense and myrrh with hollow wine.[273p]

　　下疳熏法：菉豆一升，煮极烂，茶叶五钱，研末，乘热倾在多年马桶内，在无风处熏之，待出一身汗，妙甚。男妇并用。
　　银粉散：治下疳阴头生疮。用墙上白螺蛳壳，不拘多少，火内煅酥为末，水内飞过先去上石粗者。次用轻粉，随分两入在末内，每以少许干贴在疮上。
　　阴部生疮：以鲫鱼胆搽之。

　　小肠疝痛：延胡索盐炒五钱，全蝎一钱为末，酒下一钱。或与干姜等分，末服亦佳。 【《入门》】
　　隐处疼痛：盐三合，炒热，青布包熨之，立止。
　　卒疝痛欲死：茴香茎叶捣取汁一合，和热酒一合服之。 【《本草》，下同】
　　小便湿痛：牛膝五两，酒二升，煮半升，去滓，作三服服之。
　　小肠疝气，三服除根：地椒一名地蒺藜，五钱，大戟五钱，水煮，食前服。服后，比口如三角形，上于脐中两脐旁，各灸三壮，艾炷如小麦大。[274p]

Method for Treating Ulcers:
Take one sheng of kidney beans, boil until very soft, then add five qian of tea leaves, ground into a fine powder. While hot, sprinkle it into a long-used toilet, and smoke it in a windless place until you sweat profusely; this is remarkably effective. Suitable for both men and women.

Silver Powder for Ulcers:
Used for treating ulcers caused by lower genital infections. Take white snail shells from walls, regardless of quantity, calcine them in fire until they become powdered, and separate the coarser parts from the finer ones. Then, mix in light powder in equal parts, and apply a small amount of the mixture dry onto the ulcer.

Ulcers in the Genital Area:
Rub with crucian carp bile.

Pain from Intestinal Hernia:
Use five qian of processed Corydalis tuber fried with salt, and one qian of whole scorpion, ground into powder, mixed with one qian of wine. Alternatively, combine with equal parts dried ginger for an equally good effect.

Pain in Hidden Areas:
Mix three he of salt, fry it until hot, then pack it in a blue cloth to apply as a compress, which will relieve the pain immediately.

Severe Hernia Pain:
Crush the stems and leaves of fennel to extract one he of juice, then mix with one he of hot wine and take.

Painful Urination:
Use five liang of Achyranthes bidentata, combined with two sheng of wine, boil down to half a sheng, strain, and take in three doses.

For Intestinal Hernia, Three Doses to Eliminate the Root:
Take five qian of ground earth pepper (also known as earth spikes) and five qian of Euphorbia, boil in water and take before meals. After taking, the abdomen will feel like a triangle shape; apply moxibustion with small moxa cones, the size of wheat grains, at two points next to the navel.[274p]

　　丹胞散：治玉茎生疮臭烂者。以猪胞一个，连尿去一半，留一半，用新砖两口炭火煅，将猪胞连尿于砖上焙干，不住手移放于两口砖上，轮流不歇，莫与火煅着胞，待尿干为度，研为末，入黄丹一钱。先用葱汤，以鹅毛抹洗，以旧帛拭干，此药掺三五次，立见效。

Danbao Powder: For treating sores and rotten tissue from jade stems. Take one pig bladder, remove half of the urine, keep the other half; calcine it on a new brick with two pieces of charcoal, drying the bladder with urine on the brick without stopping to move it around, ensuring the bladder does not get burnt. Wait until the urine is completely dry, grind it into powder, and add one penny of yellow lead. First, use scallion broth, brush it clean with a goose feather, then dry with an old cloth. This medicine can be mixed three to five times, and results will be evident.

　　小肠气及木肾偏坠：黑牵牛一斤，用猪尿胞装满，以线缚定口子，好酒米酢各一碗，于砂锅内煮干为度，取出黑牵牛用青红娘子各十九个，于铁锅内炒燥，去青红娘子，将牵牛碾取头末四两，另入猪苓、泽泻细末各二两，酢糊丸如梧桐子大，每服三十丸，空心盐酒送下，不可多服。多服令人头眩。如头眩，可服黑锡丹。

　　国老汤：治悬痈。用横纹大甘草一两，截长三寸许，取出，山涧东流水一碗，不用井水、河水，以甘草蘸水，文武火慢炙，不可急性，须用三时久，水尽为度，劈视草中润透；却以无灰酒二碗，煮至一碗，温服，一日一服，半月消尽为度。【《古今医鉴》】
　　凤衣散：治下疳疮肿痛，神效。用凤凰衣煅，黄连各等分，轻粉、片脑各少许为末，湿用干掺，干用鸭子清调搽。【《医学入门》】[278p]

Lunao San: One and a half taels of lithargy, eight qian of huanglian, cook together in a clay pot overnight, remove the huanglian, dry the lithargy, reduce to a fine powder, mix with five parts to use, for treating lower sores; or soak slightly in broth to wash all eye diseases.

Dan Zhu Ru Tang: One tael of bamboo shavings, boil in water to make a concentrated juice to take, for treating labor-related afflictions, testicular swelling, and severe abdominal pain.

Zhu Pao Wan: A pair of black boar kidneys, without water, membrane removed and chopped finely, two taels each of large fennel powder mixed with the kidney, then take one pig's bladder, place the mixture inside, secure it, and boil in a clay pot with three bowls of wine until reduced to half a bowl; dry and grind to a powder, use the remaining wine to form pills the size of a walnut, take fifty pills with warm wine, for removing all types of hernias.

Guo Lao Tang: For treating hanging sores. Use one tael of horizontal patterned licorice, cut into pieces about three inches long, take out a bowl of eastern mountain spring water (do not use well or river water), dip the licorice in the water, slowly roast over gentle flames for three hours without rushing, until the water has evaporated, check that the licorice is fully soaked; then add two bowls of ash-free wine, boil down to one bowl, take warm, once a day, for half a month until gone.

  2. For the initial onset of dysentery: Use one fresh (sorrel) and three qian of yellow root, simmer in water, and take continuously for effective results.
  3. For dysentery with exposure: Crush fresh ginger and plantain root and apply as a poultice. Alternatively, mix scallion roots with honey and apply, protecting it with paper, along with an exterior air-circulating medicine for recovery.
  4. To treat lower ulcerations: Equal parts of realgar and yellow root ground into powder; apply wet with dry or mix with oil. First wash with a decoction of schizonepeta and bulrush, then apply for best results.
  5. For the initial onset of dysentery: Seven walnuts, roasted and ground with wine, take no more than three doses for effect.
  6. For dysentery with swelling and pain: Roast soap pods and burnt rice flour equally, grind into powder, mix with hot vinegar, and apply to the affected area; frequently moisten with water for immediate effect. Alternatively, use seven slices of pig's tooth soap pod, simmer it, remove the skin and string, grind into powder, and take five qian with warm wine on an empty stomach.
  7. For abscesses and sores: One soap pod cooked with vinegar into a paste for application, repeatedly effective.
  8. For ulceration of the jade stem: Crush loofah and its seeds to extract juice, add five times the amount of sumac powder, and apply.
  9. For painful cold dysuria: Grind leaves of the chaste tree into powder, take three qian, with one cup of water, and seven inches of scallion white, simmer down to two-thirds, strain, and take warm before meals, twice daily.[281p]

　　下疳：青黛、海蛤、密陀僧、黄连共为末，敷上。
　　男子阴疮有二种：一者阴蚀作臼脓出，一者只生热疮。热疮，用黄蘗、黄芩等分煎汤洗之，仍以黄蘗、黄连作末傅之。又法：黄蘗煎汤洗之，涂以白蜜。【《肘后方》】
　　阴疮湿痒：槐树北面不见日枝，煎水，洗三五遍，冷再暖之。 【《必效方》】
　　下疳疮：用密陀僧、黄蘗各一分半，腻粉一钱，麝香少许，先洗疮拭干敷之，甚者三四次即瘥。
　　外肾偏疼：皂角和皮为末，水调敷之，良。
　　便毒初起：肥皂捣烂，敷之，甚效。 【《简便方》】
　　玉茎湿痒：肥皂一个，烧存性，香油调搽即愈。 【《摄生方》】
　　阴卒肿痛：柳枝三尺长，二十枝，细銼，水煮极热，以故帛裹包肿处，仍以热汤洗之。【《集验方》】
　　囊疮痛痒：红椒七粒，葱头七个，煮水洗之。一人途中苦此，相山寺僧授此方，数日愈，名驱风散。【《经验方》】[282p]

Lower Sore: Mix indigo, clam shell, myrrh, and Huanglian into a fine powder and apply to the sore.

Male Genital Ulcer Types: There are two types: one leads to pitting and pus formation, while the other is just a heat sore. For heat sores, wash with a decoction of Huanglian and Huangkui in equal parts, and then apply powder of Huanglian and Huangqin. Another method is to wash with Huanglian decoction and coat with honey.

Itching Ulcers: Use branches of a locust tree that do not see sunlight on the north side, boil in water, and wash three to five times, alternating between cold and warm.

Lower Sore Ulcer: Take one and a half parts of myrrh and Huanglian, one-tenth part of fine powder, and a pinch of musk. First, wash the sore and dry it, then apply the mixture; severe cases may heal in three to four applications.

Local Kidney Pain: Grind soap pods and their skins into powder, mix with water and apply; it is effective.

Initial Stages of Faecal Poison: Crush soap and apply; it works remarkably well.

Moist Itching in the Genital Area: Take one bar of soap, burn it to ash, mix with sesame oil, and apply to cure.

Sudden Swelling and Pain: Take three feet of willow branches, twenty in total, finely shred, boil in water until extremely hot, wrap in cloth and apply to the swollen area, and continue washing with hot broth.

Painful and Itchy Blisters: Use seven red chili peppers and seven shallots, boil in water and wash with it. A person who suffered this received the remedy from a monk at Xiangshan Temple and recovered in a few days, named "Wind-Dispersing Powder."[282p]

　　男女下疳：母猪屎黄泥固济，烧存性为末，以米泔洗净，搽立效。 【《简便单方》】
　　阴头生疮，人不能治者：鳖甲一枚烧研，鸡子白和敷。 【《千金翼》】
　　疗人阴生疮，脓出成坎：取高昌矾、麻仁等分研，炼猪脂相和成膏，槐白皮煎汤洗疮，拭干即涂膏，然后以楸叶贴其上，不过三五度，瘥。

　　阴头疳蚀：鸡内金不落水，拭净，新瓦焙脆，出火毒，为细末，先以米泔水洗疮，乃搽之。亦治口疳。【《经验方》】[283p]

  1. For sores (chancre) on the genitals: Use yellow mud from sow's dung, burn it to retain its essence and grind it into a powder. Wash with rice wash water and apply for immediate effect.

  2. For ulcers on the glans that cannot be treated by anyone: Take one tortoise shell, burn and grind it, then mix with egg white and apply.

　　便毒便痈：穿山甲半两，猪苓二钱，并以酢炙研末，酒服二钱，外以穿山甲末和麻油轻粉涂之，或只以土涂之。【《直指方》】
　　下部疳疮：用五倍子、枯矾等分研末，先以虀水洗过搽之。 【《全幼心鉴》】　　又方：用五倍子、花椒去子炒。各一钱，细辛焙三分，为末，先以葱汤洗净搽之，一二日生肉也。【《杏林摘要》，下同】
　　鱼口疮毒初起，未成脓者：五倍子炒黄研末，入百草霜等分，以蜡酢调涂于患处，一日一夜即消。
　　便痈脓血：白胶香一两为末，入麝香轻粉少许掺之。 【《袖珍方》】

　　台露(疒其)，即羊核：用石首胶一两，烧存性，研末酒服，外以石菖蒲生研盦之，效。【戴氏方】
　　地连散：治玉茎上生疮。用地骨皮煎汤洗，以诃子连核烧存性为末，干掺。[284p]

Here is the translation of the Classical Chinese text:

  • For toxins and sores: Half a tael of pangolin, two qian of pig's fungus, grind together with vinegar and roast, then take two qian mixed with wine; externally apply ground pangolin mixed with sesame oil or just clay.

  • For lower body sores: Use equal parts of gall and burnt alum, grind into powder, and wash with diluted water before applying. Another prescription: Use one qian of gall and one qian of pepper (seeds removed), fry them; three fen of dried wild ginger, grind to powder, wash with scallion soup before applying, for healing after a day or two.

  • For initial fish-mouth sores or toxins that haven't yet formed pus: Fry gall until yellow and grind to powder, mix with equal parts of Baicao Frost, and apply with a mixture of wax and vinegar; it will resolve in a day or night.

  • For sores with pus and blood: One tael of white glue incense ground to powder, mix in a little musk powder.

  • For painful swelling from toxins that have become large and soft: Use fish bladder glue in hot soup, or boil with vinegar until soft, then apply while hot.

  • For Taiwan's disease (referring to an ailment named "sheep's kernel"): Use one tael of stone head glue, burn until it retains its form, then grind to powder and take with wine; externally use ground fresh fragrant calamus, effective.

  • Dielian Powder: Treats sores on the jade stem. Use the skin of the earth bone to brew soup for washing, and grind burned haritaki seeds to a powder for dry application.[284p]

　　一切疳疮，马明退烧灰三钱，轻粉、乳香少许，先以温浆水洗净敷之，良。 【《儒门事亲》】
　　男子阴疮，因不忌月事行房，阴物溃烂：用室女血衲，瓦上烧存性研末，麻油调敷之。
　　肾风下注生疮：用驴蹄二十片烧灰，密陀僧、轻粉各一钱，麝香半钱为末敷。 【《奇效方》】
　　阴上疳疮：用驼绒烧灰，水澄过，入炒黄丹等分为末，搽之即效。 【《龚氏经验方》】
　　便毒初起：大黑蜘蛛一枚，研烂，热酒一碗，搅服，随左右侧卧，取利，不退，再服必效。【《寿域方》】
　　便毒初起：水胶熔化涂之即散。 【《直指方》】
　　川连散：治下部注疮。以黄连为细末，浆水调成，饼摊于碗面上，内用艾及穿山甲三片烧烟，覆碗，熏成黑色，再取下。如是者五次，以黄连饼黑色为度，地上出烟毒再研细。湿则干涂，干则清油调涂三四次。先用黄蘗、藿香、茵陈煎汤湿洗。[285p]

All types of sores: for treatment, use three qian of Ma Ming's fever-reducing ash, a small amount of talcum powder and frankincense; first wash the area with warm rice water and apply, which is effective.

For male genital sores caused by not avoiding intercourse during menstruation, leading to ulceration: use the blood of a virgin to soak, grind to powder after burning on a tile, and mix with sesame oil for application.

For kidney wind causing sores: use twenty pieces of donkey hoof, burn to ash, mix with one qian each of myrrh and talcum powder, and half a qian of musk, grind to powder for application.

For upper genital sores: use ash from camel wool, clarify with water, and mix with equal parts of roasted yellow earth to form a powder for application, which yields immediate effects.

For initial onset of toxic bowel issues: take one large black spider, grind it up, mix with a bowl of hot wine, stir and consume, lie on your left side, and after relieving yourself, if not resolved, take again for effectiveness.

For initial onset of toxic bowel issues: melt water-based glue and apply, which will disperse the issue.

For treating lower body sores with Chuan Lian San: grind yellow lian into fine powder, mix with rice water into a paste, spread on a bowl's surface, burn three pieces of mugwort and pangolin until they produce smoke, cover the bowl, and allow to blacken; repeat this five times. Once the paste is blackened, grind it finely again. If it is wet, apply dry, and if dry, mix with clear oil for three or four applications. First, wash with decoction of Huanglian, Huoxiang, and Yinchen.[285p]

　　下部生疮：檞皮、榉皮煮汁，熬如饴糖，以导下部。 【《肘后方》】

  1. For sores in the lower region: boil willow and beech bark to extract juice, reduce it until thick like syrup for application.

Bind with hair and burn until the smoke is gone, then grind into powder. 　　　　　针灸

　　《素问》曰：腰痛不可以转摇，急引阴卵，刺八髎与痛上。八髎，在腰尻分间。　　病在少腹，腹痛，不得大小便，病名曰疝，得之寒。刺少腹两股间，刺腰踝骨间。刺而多之尽炅，病已。　　督脉者，起于小腹以下骨中央，女子入系庭孔，其孔溺孔之端也；其络循阴器，合纂间，绕纂后，别绕臀至少阴，与巨阳中络者合，少阴上股内后廉，贯脊属肾；其男子循茎下至纂，与女子等。此生病而从少腹上冲心而痛，不得前后，为冲疝。其女子不孕，癃痔，遗溺，嗌干。督脉生病治督脉，治在骨上，甚者在脐下营。　　邪客于足厥阴之络，令人卒疝暴痛。刺足大指爪甲上与肉交者各一痏，男子立已，女子有顷已。左取右，右取左。　　《灵枢》曰：足太阴之筋，其病阴器纽痛，下引脐两胁痛，治在燔针劫刺，以知为数，以痛为腧。　　小肠控睾，引腰脊上冲心，邪在小肠者，连睾系，属于脊，贯肝肺，络心系。[289p]

Acupuncture

The "Su Wen" states: When there is low back pain, one cannot turn or shake; urgently needling the Yin and egg points, the eight hui points should be needled alongside the pain. The eight hui points are located between the waist and buttocks. When there is disease in the lower abdomen with abdominal pain, preventing bowel movements, the condition is called hernia, caused by cold. Needle between the lower abdomen and thighs, and between the ankle bone and the waist. Needling should be thorough to promote healing; with needling, the illness is resolved.

The Du meridian begins from the center of the bones below the lower abdomen. In women, it connects to the uterus cavity, which is situated at the end of the urinary opening; it transmits to the yin organs, encircles the coccyx, separates and connects to the perineium, and merges with the major yang energy in the body, linking to the lesser yin on the inner side of the thigh and penetrating the spine to associate with the kidneys. For men, it follows the penis down to the perineum, similar to women. When illness arises and rushes from the lower abdomen up to the heart causing pain, preventing forward and backward movement, it is called "chong hernia." Women may experience infertility, urinary retention, incontinence, and dry throat. Illness in the Du meridian is treated along the Du meridian itself, preferably at the bones, and in severe cases, below the navel.

Evil influences affecting the foot's jueyin meridian can cause sudden severe pain from hernia. Needle the area where the big toe's nail and flesh meet, for both men and women. Treat the left for the right, and the right for the left.

The "Ling Shu" says: The pain in the muscles of the foot's taiyin meridian is associated with the pain of the yin organs, pulling down to the sides of the abdomen, treated with fire needles and points, using the pain as a guide for method.

The small intestine controls the testicles, pulling the spine upward to the heart, where evil resides in the small intestine, connecting to the testicular cords, relating to the spine, penetrating the liver and lung, and linking to the heart cord.[289p]

气盛则厥逆上冲，肠胃熏肝，散于肓，结于脐，故取之肓原以散之，刺太阴以予之，取厥阴以下之，取巨虚、下廉以去之，按其所过之经以调之。　　足厥阴之别，名曰蠡沟，去内踝五寸，别走少阳，其别者循胫上睾结于茎。其病气逆则睾肿卒疝，实则挺长，虚则暴痒，取之所别也。　　小肠病者，小腹痛，腰脊控睾而痛，时窘之后，当耳前热。若寒甚，若独肩上热，甚则手小指次指之间热，若脉陷者，此其候也。手太阳病也，取之巨虚下廉。　　《甲乙经》曰：腰足痛而清，善偃睾跳拳，上髎主之。　　腰痛急难，阴痛下重，不得小便，秩边主之。　　小腹痛控睾引腰脊，疝痛上冲心，腰脊强，溺黄赤，口干，小肠俞主之。　　狐疝惊悸少气，巨阙巨阙　原作「巨缺」据《甲乙经》卷九改。主之。　　狐疝惊悸少气，巨阙巨阙　原作「巨缺」据《甲乙经》卷九改。主之。　　少腹痛，溺难，阴下纵，横骨主之。　　少腹痛疝，卧善惊，气海主之。[290p]

When the qi is abundant, it causes counterflow and upward surging, affecting the liver through the intestines and stomach. It disperses to the diaphragm and is tied at the navel, thus one should take from the diaphragm to disperse. Use the taiyin point to give relief, taking from below the jueyin, and also from the juxu and xialian points to eliminate it. Press along the pathways it travels to regulate it.

The foot jueyin diverges, termed ligou, located five inches from the inner ankle, it separately travels to the shaoyang. Its pathway ascends through the shins and concludes at the testes. When the qi is reversed, it causes swelling and sudden hernias; if excess, it protrudes, and if deficient, it is violently itching, hence the treatment is at its divergence.

For issues in the small intestine, there is pain in the lower abdomen, with aching in the waist and spine radiating to the testes. At times this aggravates and brings heat to the front of the ear. If there is intense cold, the heat might be only on one shoulder, and if severe, heat can be felt between the little finger and next finger. If the pulse is sunken, this is the sign.

Hand taiyang issues should be treated by using the juxu and xialian points. The "Yao Yi Jing" states: For pain in the waist and legs that is clear, it is good to press the testes and jump, with the shangjiao as the main point.

For sudden acute pain in the lower back, heavy pain in the lower regions, and inability to urinate, zhi bian is the treatment.

When there is pain in the lower abdomen affecting the testes, pulling on the waist and spine, with hernia pain surging to the heart, if the waist and spine are stiff, with yellow or red urine, and dry mouth, the small intestine shu point is the treatment.

For fox hernia with palpitations and shortness of breath, treat at the juxu point.

For pain in the lower abdomen and difficulty urinating, along the lateral bones is where treatment should focus.

For pain in the lower abdomen related to hernia, if lying down induces anxiety, the qihai point should be treated.[290p]

　　暴疝，少腹大热，关元主之。
　　阴疝气疝，天枢主之。
　　(疒颓)疝，大巨及地机、中郄主之。　　阴疝痿茎中痛，两丸骞，卧不可仰卧，刺气街主之。　　阴疝，冲门主之。
　　男子阴疝，两丸上下，小腹痛，五枢主之。　　阴股内痛，气痈，狐疝走上下，引少腹，痛不可俯仰，商丘主之。　　狐疝，太冲主之。[291p]

For violent hernias, which cause great heat in the lower abdomen, it is governed by the Guanyuan point.
For yin hernias and qi hernias, the Tianshu point is the main point.
For (a certain type of) hernia, the Dajue and Digong points are the main points.
For yin hernias with pain in the inner genitals, and with both testicles rising, where one cannot lie on their back, the Xiejie point is the main point.
For yin hernias, the Chongmen point is the main point.
For male hernias with testicles moving up and down, accompanied by pain in the lower abdomen, the Wushu point is the main point.
For internal pain in the inner thigh, qi accumulation, where the fox hernia moves up and down, pulling on the lower abdomen, causing unbearable pain with bending or lying flat, the Shangqiu point is the main point.
For the fox hernia, the Taichong point is the main point.[291p]

　　阴跳遗溺，小便难而痛，阴上下入腹中，寒疝，阴挺出，偏大肿，腹脐痛，腹中悒悒不乐，大敦主之。　　腹痛上抢心，心下满癃，茎中痛，怒瞋不欲视，泣出，长太息，行间主之。　　(疒颓)疝阴暴痛，中封主之。
　　疝癃，脐少腹引痛，腰中痛，中封主之。　　气癃(疒颓)疝，阴急，股枢腨内廉痛，交信主之。　　阴跳腰痛，实则挺长，寒热挛，阴暴痛，遗溺偏大，虚则暴痒，气逆，肿睾卒疝，小便不利如癃状，数噫恐悸，气不足，腹中悒悒，少腹痛，隘中有热，如有瘜肉状，如着欲出，背挛不可俯仰，蠡沟主之。　　丈夫(疒颓)疝阴跳，痛引篡中，不得溺，腹中支，胁下榰满，闭癃阴痿，后时泄，四肢不收，实则身疼痛，汗不出，目(目巟)(目巟)然无所见，怒欲杀人，暴痛引髌，下节时有热气，筋挛膝痛，不可屈伸，狂如新发，衄，不食，喘呼，少腹痛引噫，足厥痛，涌泉主之。　　癃疝，然谷主之。[292p]

The text describes a series of medical symptoms and their associated treatments, which can be summarized as follows:

  • When there is difficulty and pain in urination, accompanied by a sensation of cold in the lower abdomen, or if there is swelling and pain in the umbilical area with feelings of unhappiness, treat with Dazhun.
  • For severe abdominal pain radiating to the heart, and fullness below the heart leading to pain in the genitals, accompanied by anger and inability to see clearly, treat with Xingjian.
  • For acute pain in the lower regions, treat with Zhongfeng.
  • When experiencing pain in the navel and lower abdomen along with lumbar pain, manage with Zhongfeng.
  • If there is urgency in urination and pain in the inner thigh area, treat with Jiaoxin.
  • Pain in the genitals and lumbar region, with symptoms of hardening, cold and heat sensation, and swelling in the testicles leading to obstructed urination, anxiety, fullness in the abdomen, and pain in the lower abdomen, can be managed with Ligou.
  • In men, when there is jumping pain in the genitals, feelings of fullness in the abdomen, pressure in the sides, and inability to urinate, it may lead to various pains throughout the body, sweating difficulties, and a sense of losing control, treat with Yungquan.
  • For obstructed urination and related symptoms, manage with Rangu.

This interpretation organizes the symptoms and the recommended treatments based on the ancient medical understanding presented in the text.[292p]

　　卒疝，少腹痛，照海主之。病在左取右，右取左，立已。　　疝，四肢淫泺，身闷，至阴主之。
　　《千金方》曰：失精筋挛，阴缩入腹，相引痛，灸中封五十壮，在内踝前筋里宛宛中。　　又云：灸下满各五十壮，老人加之，小儿随年壮法。　　会阴主阴头寒。
　　行间主茎中痛。
　　阴谷主阴痿不用，小腹急引阴内廉痛。　　阴(疒颓)，灸足大趾下理中十壮，随肿边灸之。《肘后方》云：灸足趺趾第二节下横文，正中央五壮。姚氏云：足趺指本三壮。　　阴肿痛，灸大敦三壮。
　　曲泉主(疒颓)疝阴跳，痛引脐中，不尿，阴痿。一云痛引茎中，不得尿。　　中都，主(疒颓)疝崩中。
　　中脘主冲疝，冒死不知人。[293p]

When suffering from hernia, with pain in the lower abdomen, the point "Zhaohai" is to be treated. For pain on the left, treat the right; for pain on the right, treat the left; the treatment is immediate. For hernia, when the limbs feel heavy and the body is oppressed, "Zhiyin" is the main point to address.

The "Qianjin Fang" states: loss of essence leads to muscle spasms and the penis drawing into the abdomen, causing referred pain. Cauterize 50 times at the middle of the tendon in front of the inner ankle. It further mentions: cauterize 50 times below the malleolus for adults; for children, follow the age-adjusted method. The point at the perineum is for coldness in the head of the penis.

The point "Xingjian" is for pain in the shaft, and "Yingu" is for impotence and urgent pulling pain in the lower abdomen. For hernia (ta), cauterize 10 times beneath the big toe, and along the edges where swelling occurs. The "Zhou Hou Fang" states: cauterize 5 times at the center below the second joint of the foot’s second toe. According to the Yao family, the third joint of the toe should have 3 cauterizations.

For painful swelling at the genitals, cauterize 3 times at "Datun." "Ququan" manages the hernia with pain that radiates to the belly button, presenting with an inability to urinate and impotence. Another source indicates pain radiating from the penis with inability to urinate. "Zhongdu" addresses pecuniary hernia and severe cases with no awareness of surroundings.

"Zhongwan" deals with "chong" hernia, which can be fatal with no awareness of the person.[293p]

　　合阳、中郄主(疒颓)疝崩中，腹上下痛，肠澼，阴暴败痛。　　照海主四肢淫泺，身闷阴暴起疝。
　　太溪主胞中有大疝瘕积聚，与阴相引。　　关元主(疒颓)疝，又云主暴疝痛。　　肩井，旁肩解与臂相接处，主偏(疒颓)。　　脐中、石门、天枢、气海，主小腹疝气，游行五脏，绕脐痛，冲胸，不得息。　　四满主脐下疝积。
　　大阴郄、冲门主疝疾阴疝。
　　天枢主气疝，呕。
　　大巨主(疒颓)疝偏枯。
　　少府主阴痛，实时挺长，寒热，阴暴痛，遗尿，偏虚则暴痒，气逆，卒疝，小便不利。　　大赫、然谷主精溢，阴上缩。
　　阴市主寒疝，下至腹胯膝腰痛如清水，小腹诸疝疝　原作「痛」，据《千金》卷三十改。，按之下至膝上伏兔中，寒疝痛，腹胀满，痿少气。　　太冲、中封、地机主(疒颓)疝，精不足。又云：太冲主狐疝，呕厥。　　阴交、石门主两丸骞。又云：石门主腹满疝疾。　　太冲主两丸骞缩，腹坚不得卧。[294p]

In He yang and Zhong qi, the primary focus is on the pain caused by hernia and internal bleeding, accompanied by abdominal pain, intestinal disorders, and severe pelvic pain.

Zhao hai regulates the limbs' disorders and the heat of the body, leading to hernia.

Tai xi addresses large hernias and accumulations within the uterus, affecting the pelvic region.

Guan yuan deals with hernia issues and also refers to acute hernia pain.

Jian jing, located at the shoulder girdle where it connects with the arm, governs lateral hernias.

The points around the umbilicus, including Shi men, Tian shuo, and Qi hai, target lower abdominal hernias, influence the internal organs, and can lead to pain around the navel and chest, with difficulty in breathing.

Si man specifically addresses accumulations beneath the navel.

Da yin xie and Chong men focus on hernia-related issues, particularly in the pelvic area.

Tian shuo governs gas hernias and vomiting.

Da ju deals with hernias that are particularly neglected.

Shao fu addresses pelvic pain that varies in intensity, with cold and heat symptoms, sudden onset of pain, frequent urination, and can lead to itching, gastrointestinal reversals, acute hernia, and difficulty in urination.

Da he and ran gu focus on seminal overflow and retraction of the pelvic organs.

Yin shi predominates in cold hernias that cause pain in the lower abdomen, hips, knees, and waist akin to clear water, with various lower abdominal complaints corrected from "pain" in the text. Pressing down may lead to knee pain, with symptoms of cold hernias leading to abdominal distension and weakness.

Tai chong, Zhong feng, and Di ji address hernias with insufficient essence, with Tai chong also associated with fox hernias and symptoms of nausea and fainting.

Yin jiao and Shi men focus on issues concerning the testes. Shi men also addresses abdominal distension due to hernias.

Tai chong handles retraction of the testes and cases where the abdomen is firm and uncomfortable for lying down.[294p]

　　《济生方》曰：阴卵偏大(疒颓)病，关元，在脐下三寸，灸百壮，良。　　七疝，用盐半斤炒极热，以故帛包熨痛处。　　《儒门事亲》曰：疝病，以艾炷放疝边竖纹左右交弦，灸七壮。　　《东垣十书》曰：卒疝痛，刺足厥阴。　　《奇效良方》曰：张仲文神仙灸法，腰膝重痛，不可转侧，起坐难，及冷痹脚筋挛急，不可转侧屈伸，灸曲膝两文头左右脚四处，各三壮。每灸一脚，二火齐下，艾炷到肉，初觉疼痛，用二人两边齐吹，至火灭。午时着灸。人定以来，脏腑自动一两行，或转动如雷声，其疾立愈。此法神效，卒不可量。　　《医学纲目》曰：《内经》刺灸小腹痛，共四法：一曰肝经。[295p]

The "Jisheng Fang" states: For the illness of large slippage, the key point is located three inches below the umbilicus. Moxibustion with one hundred cups is effective. For the seven types of hernia, take half a pound of salt, fry it until extremely hot, and use a cloth bag to apply it to the painful area. The "Rumen Shiqin" says that for hernia, place moxa sticks on either side of the hernia or in a vertical cross pattern, and perform moxibustion seven times. The "Dongyuan Shishu" mentions that for sudden hernia pain, you should puncture the foot's Jueyin point. The "Qixiao Liangfang" describes Zhang Zhongwen's miraculous moxibustion method for heavy pain in the lower back and knees, where turning or sitting is difficult, and for cold cramps in the legs that make bending and stretching impossible. Moxibustion is applied at the knee on both sides and at the four locations of the feet, three times each. Each moxibustion on a foot involves two flames being applied until the moxa ignites on the flesh. Initially, there is pain; having two people blowing on both sides helps until the fire is extinguished. This should be done at noon. Once the person is settled, the organs may spontaneously shift or move with a rumbling sound, leading to immediate recovery. This method is remarkably effective and cannot be overestimated. The "Yixue Gangmu" states that in the "Neijing," there are four methods for treating lower abdominal pain with acupuncture and moxibustion, the first concerning the liver meridian.[295p]

曰肝病者，两胁下痛引小腹，取其经厥阴、少阳；又曰：邪客厥阴之络，令人卒疝暴痛，刺足大指爪甲上与肉交者各一痏，男子立已，女子有顷已，左取右、右取左者是也。　　二曰小肠经。曰小肠病者，小肠痛，腰脊控睾而痛，时窘之后，取巨虚下廉；又云：小肠控睾，引腰脊上冲心，邪在小肠，取之肓原以散之，刺太阴以予之，取厥阴以下之，巨虚下廉以去之，按其所过之经以调之是也，又云：疝暴痛，取足太阴厥阴，尽刺去其血络。　　三曰膀胱经。[296p]

It is said that liver disease manifests as pain under the ribs extending to the lower abdomen, affecting the channels of the Jueyin and Shaoyang. Furthermore, it is stated that when the pathogen invades the collaterals of the Jueyin, it causes sudden and severe pain similar to hernia, which can be treated by needling the area where the big toe nail meets the flesh on either side, with men needing to stand and women needing a moment of rest; one should treat the left side for the right side and the right side for the left.

Secondly, concerning the small intestine channel. It is said that small intestine disease brings about pain in the small intestine, along with pain in the lumbar region affecting the testes, often occurring after discomfort. For treatment, one should needle the points of Ju Void (Juxu) and below the lateral border. It is further noted that pain in the small intestine can extend to the lumbar region, affecting the heart, indicating that the pathogen resides in the small intestine; to dispel it, needle Huāngyuán to scatter and Taīyīn to provide relief, targeting points below Jueyin and utilizing Ju Void to remove it, and apply pressure along its pathways to balance the energy. Additionally, for sudden severe pain, needle the points of the foot Taiyin and Jueyin to drain the blood collaterals.

Thirdly, addressing the bladder channel.[296p]

云膀胱病者，小腹偏肿而痛，以手按之，即欲小便而不得，取委中央；又云：小腹痛肿，不得小便，邪在三焦约，取之足太阳大络者是也。　　四曰督任冲脉经。曰督脉生病，从少腹上冲心而痛，不得前后，为冲疝；任脉为病，男子内结之疝，女子带下瘕聚是也。　　元脏发动，脐下痛不可忍，取气海、三阴交立愈。左取右，右取左。　　疝气少腹偏痛：取大敦二分，沿皮向后三分，泻之，并灸，左取右，右取左；三阴交一寸，泻十吸。　　又法：取大敦、水道、小海。
　　又法：取中极、印肾。
　　卒疝少腹痛不可忍：取大敦三分，陷六呼[陷六呼　疑当作「泻六呼」。]，灸七壮；阴市三分，灸五壮；照海三分，灸七壮。已上皆左取右，右取左。　　痃癖小肠膀胱肾余疝气：取气海、五枢，各用燔针刺入五分，灸百壮。又取三里、三阴交。　　疝：取三阴交、足三里、三间。[297p]

For those suffering from bladder disease, the lower abdomen is swollen and painful on one side; pressing it with the hand causes the urge to urinate but fails to produce urine. Treatment is applied at the central point. Additionally, if there is pain and swelling in the lower abdomen, with inability to urinate, it indicates an evil in the Sanjiao; treatment relies on the foot Taiyang channel.

Next is the discussion on the governing, conception, and chong channels. It is said that if the Governor Meridian becomes ill, pain arises from the lower abdomen and radiates upward towards the heart, preventing forward and backward movement, known as chong hernia. If the Conception Meridian is affected, men may suffer from hernias, while women may experience leucorrhea and abdominal masses.

When the Yuan organs become activated, if there is unbearable pain below the navel, treatment should be done at Qihai and Sanyinjiao for immediate relief. Treat the left side while taking from the right, and vice versa.

For hernia with pain on one side of the lower abdomen, acupuncture is applied at Dading (Da Dun) two fen, three fen towards the back along the skin, with drainage and moxibustion; treat from the left while taking from the right, and vice versa. At Sanyinjiao, one cun is drained for ten inhales.

Another method involves using points: Dading, Shuidao, and Xiaohai.

Additionally, moxibustion is applied at Zhongji and Yinshi (Yin Kidney).

In cases of sudden unbearable pain from hernia in the lower abdomen, use Dading three fen, drain for six breaths, and perform moxibustion seven times; at Yinshi, three fen and moxibustion five times; at Zhaohai, three fen and moxibustion seven times. All these treatments are performed from the left while taking from the right, and vice versa.

For abdominal masses and hernia involving the small intestine, bladder, and kidney, acupuncture is performed at Qihai and Wushu, with burning needles inserted five fen and complementary moxibustion performed one hundred times. Additionally, treat at Sanli and Sanyinjiao.

For hernias: treat at Sanyinjiao, Zusanli, and Sanjian.[297p]

　　疝：取行间、三里。
　　大法：疝病取关门、关元、水道、三阴交，不已再取海底、归来。　　少腹痛：取关元、三里。
　　《内经》刺灸(疒颓)疝共四法。其一节，此篇文所谓铍石取睾囊中水液者是也。其法今世人亦多能之。睾丸囊大如斗者，中藏秽液，必有数升，信知此出古法也。　　其二取肝。经云：足厥阴之脉，是动则病丈夫(疒颓)疝，妇人少腹肿是也。是于足厥阴肝经，视盛虚热寒陷下，而施补泻，留疾与灸也。　　其三取肝之络。经云：足厥阴之别，名曰蠡沟，去内踝五寸，别走少阳，其别者，循胫上睾结于茎，其病气逆，则睾肿卒疝取之所别是也。是于内踝上五寸，贴胫骨后近肉处，蠡沟取之也。　　其四取足阳明筋。经云：足阳明之筋，聚于阴器上腹，其病转筋，髀前肿，(疒贵)疝腹筋急，治在燔针劫刺，以知为数，以痛为腧是也。是于转筋痛处，用火针刺之也。　　治偏坠：当外肾缝沿皮针透即消。[298p]

　　《史记》仓公传曰：安陵阪里公乘项处病，臣意诊脉，曰牡疝。牡疝在膈下，上连肺，病得之内。臣意谓之，慎毋为劳力事。为劳力事，则必呕血死。处后蹴踘，要厥寒，汗出多，即呕血。臣意复诊之曰：当旦日日夕死，即死。病得之内。所以知项处病者，切其脉得番阳，番阳入虚里处，旦日死。一番一络者，牡疝也。臣意曰：他所诊期决生死，及所治已病众多，久颇忘之，不能尽识，不敢以对。[302p]

Medical Record

The "Records of the Grand Historian" states: Duke Cheng of Anling in Banli was stricken with an illness. I examined the pulse and concluded it was a type of hernia. This hernia is located beneath the diaphragm and connects to the lungs, resulting from an internal condition. My advice is to avoid strenuous activities. Engaging in such activities would surely lead to vomiting blood and death. Upon further examination, I indicated that the patient was unlikely to survive until morning; they were destined to die. This condition arises internally. Hence, I recognized that the patient would show signs of a pulse related to Fan Yang, which indicates a void within them. The prognosis is fatal. The cycle of life and death is intertwined with this hernia. I also noted that other diagnoses could determine survival and that numerous illnesses have been treated over time, making it difficult for me to recall or provide a complete diagnosis. I do not dare to respond with certainty.[302p]

　　齐北宫司空命妇出于病，众医皆以为风入中病，主在肺，刺其足少阳脉。臣意诊其脉曰：病气疝客于膀胱，难于前后，溲而溺赤，病见寒气则遗溺，使人腹肿，出于病，得之欲溺不得，因以接内。所以知出于病者，切其脉大而实，其来难，是厥阴之动也。脉来难者，疝气之客于膀胱也。腹之所以肿者，言厥阴之络结小腹也。厥阴有过则脉结动，动则腹肿。臣意即灸其足厥阴之脉左右各一所，即不遗溺而溲清，小腹痛止。即更为火齐汤以饮之。三日而疝气散，即愈。[303p]

The wife of the Minister of State from Qi's Northern Palace fell ill. All the doctors believed it to be an invasion of wind causing an illness in the middle, affecting the lungs, and they treated her by needling the Lesser Yang meridian in her feet. I, however, diagnosed her pulse and concluded: the pathological condition was a dampness obstructing the bladder, causing difficulty both in urination and defecation, with urine appearing red. When exposed to cold, it led to involuntary urination, resulting in abdominal swelling. Due to the illness, when she felt the need to urinate, she could not. This blockage was due to the disease. Hence, I discerned that those who were ill had strong and solid pulses, but their arrival was difficult, indicating the movement of the Jueyin. A difficult pulse indicates dampness obstructing the bladder. The abdominal swelling signals a blockage in the small abdomen caused by the Jueyin. When the Jueyin is excessive, the pulse becomes knotty; when it moves, it causes abdominal swelling. I suggest moxibusting the Jueyin meridians in her feet, one on each side, which will prevent involuntary urination and promote clear urination, alleviating her abdominal pain. Additionally, I shall prepare a medicinal decoction for her. After three days, the dampness will dissipate, and she will recover.[303p]

　　《游宦纪闻》曰：辛稼轩初自北方还朝，官建康，忽得(疒颓)疝之疾，重坠大如杯，有道人教以取叶珠 【即薏苡仁也，】 用东方壁土炒黄色，然后水煮烂，入砂盆内，研成膏，每用无灰酒调下二钱，即消。沙随先生晚年，亦得此疾，辛亲授此方服之，亦消。然城郭人患不能得叶珠，只于生药铺买薏苡仁，亦佳。按《本草》薏苡仁上等上上之药为君，主养命，多服不伤。欲轻身养命，不老延年者，本上经味甘微寒无毒，主拘挛不可屈伸，除风湿痹下气，除筋骨寒邪气不仁，利肠胃，消水肿，令人能食，久服轻身益气。其根下三虫生。真定平泽及田野，八月采实，采根无时。今在在有之，真良药也。蜀中巴蓬间甚多，士大夫以此相馈遗，杂之饮食间也。饶之城中有宗子善平病肾虚腰痛，沙随先生以其尊人所传宋谊叔方，用杜仲酒浸透，炙干捣罗为末，无灰酒调下。赵如方制之，三服而愈。[304p]

The "Records of Travels and Official Matters" states: When Xin Jiaxuan first returned from the north to serve in Jiangnan, he suddenly suffered from a severe illness related to the testicles, which swelled large like a cup. A certain person taught him to procure leaf pearls (which refer to Coix seeds), fry them with the yellow earth of the east, then boil them down with water until soft, and grind them into a paste in a sand pot. Each time, he would mix this paste with two qian of non-ash liquor and consume it, thus achieving a cure. In his later years, Mr. Sha Sui also contracted this illness, and Xin taught him this remedy, which also cured him. However, people in the city cannot find leaf pearls, so they can simply buy Coix seeds from herbal shops, which are also effective. According to the "Materia Medica," the highest quality Coix seed is considered superior medicine for nourishing life, and consuming it in large quantities is not harmful. For those who wish to lighten their bodies and prolong life, it has a sweet, slightly cold, and non-toxic flavor. It is primarily used to alleviate contractions that hinder movement, remove wind and dampness, ease breathlessness, eliminate cold and evil qi from the muscles and bones, benefit the digestive system, reduce edema, and improve appetite; prolonged use can lighten the body and enhance energy. Its roots are known to host three parasites. They can be harvested in Zhen ding, Pingze, and fields in August, while the roots can be gathered at any time. They are abundant and truly effective medicine. In Shu, there are many Coix seeds among the Ba Peng. Scholars and gentlemen gift them to each other, mixing them into their food. In the city of Rao, there is a lineage student suffering from kidney deficiency and lower back pain. Mr. Sha Sui applied the prescription passed down from his esteemed person, soaking Eucommia bark in wine, roasting it dry, and grinding it into powder. He mixed it with non-ash liquor for consumption. Zhao Ru formulated it accordingly, and after three doses, the patient was healed.[304p]

　　《儒门事亲》曰：律科王敏之病寒疝，脐下结聚如黄瓜，每发绕腰，急痛不能忍。戴人以舟车丸、猪肾散四五行，觉药绕病三五次而下，其泻皆水也。猪肾、甘遂皆苦寒，经言以寒治寒，万举万全。但下后忌饮冷水及寒物，宜食干物，以寒疝本是水故也。即日病减八分，食进一倍。又数日，以舟车丸百余粒、通经散四五钱，服之利下。候三四日，又服舟车丸七八十粒、猪肾散三钱，乃健步如常矣。[305p]

The "Ritual of Filial Piety" states: Wang Min suffered from a cold hernia, with a lump below the navel resembling a cucumber, causing sharp pains around the waist that were unbearable. 　　一僧病疝，发作冷气上贯齿，下贯肾，紧若绳挽，两睾时肿而冷。戴人诊两手脉细而弱，断之曰：秋脉也。此因金气在上，下伐肝木，木畏金抑而不伸，故病如是。肝气(石盘)(石薄)，不能下荣于睾丸，故其寒，实非寒也。木受金制，传之胃土，胃为阳明，故上贯齿，病非齿之病。肝木者，心火之母也。母既不伸，子亦屈伏，故下冷而水化乘之。经曰：木郁则达之，土郁则泄之。令涌泄四次，果觉气和，睾丸痒而暖。戴人曰：气已入睾中矣。以茴香、莪朮之药，使常服之，首尾一月而愈。
　　霍秀才之子，年十二岁，睾丸一旁肿坠。戴人见之曰，此因惊恐得之。惊之为病，上行则为呕血，下则肾伤而为水肿。以琥珀通经散，一泻而消散。[306p]

A monk suffered from a hernia, manifesting cold energy that rose to the teeth and descended to the kidneys, tight like a rope; at times, both testicles swelled and felt cold. A physician examined his pulse, finding it fine and weak, and diagnosed it as an autumn pulse. This was due to the metal element being above, which attacked the liver wood below; wood fears metal, thus it cannot extend, resulting in such illness. The liver energy was restrained and unable to nourish the testicles, hence their coldness—truly, it was not from coldness. Metal restrains wood, which transmits to the stomach earth; the stomach belongs to the yangming, hence the upward manifestation to the teeth; the illness was not a dental issue. The liver wood is the mother of heart fire. When the mother cannot extend, the offspring (testicles) also retract, causing them to be cold while fluids accumulate around them. The classic states: when wood is obstructed, it can be opened; when earth is obstructed, it can be drained. After allowing for four releases, he indeed felt the energy harmonize, and the testicles became itchy and warm. The physician remarked: the energy has now entered the testicles. 　　汝南司候李审言，因劳役王事，饮水坐湿地，乃湿气下行，流入脬，囊大肿痛不可忍。以金铃、川楝子等药不效，求治于戴人。曰：可服泄水丸。审言惑之。又数日，痛不可堪，竟从。戴人先以舟车丸、浚川散，下青绿沫十余行，痛止。次服茴香丸、五苓散以调之，三日而肿退，至老更不复作。夫疝者，乃肝经也。下青沫考，肝之色也。
　　《东垣十书》曰：一富者，前阴间尝闻臊臭，又因连日饮酒，腹中不和，求予治之。予应之曰：夫前阴者，足厥阴之脉络阴器，出其挺孔。凡臭者心之所主，散入五方为五臭，入肝为臊，此其一也。当于肝经中泻行间，是治其本；后于心经中泻少冲，乃治其标。如恶针，当用药除之。酒者，气味俱阳，能生里之湿热，是风湿合于下焦为邪。故经云：下焦如渎。又云：在下者引而竭之。酒是湿热之水，亦宜决前阴而去之。[307p]

Li Shenyin, the county official of Runan, suffered from a swelling and excruciating pain in his testicles due to labor for the king, after drinking water while sitting on the wet ground. The green froth expelled corresponds to the color of the liver.
